loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is 52 years old and married with four children who go to school. He has been running a taxi business in Nairobi to earn a living. He has been in the business for nine years and has two employees. He describes himself as humble and hardworking.

Calvin saves his money with a group in Faulu Kenya. They meet on a weekly basis to save their money and the group guarantees loans. This is his first loan. He is determined to grow his business and improve his living conditions now that he can access loans. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to spray his vehicle and replace the vehicle's tyres. He hopes to double his turnover and improve his living conditions in the future. His wish is to see his children go through school and be professionals.

loans.use: To spray his vehicle and replace the vehicle's tyres

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: R. is 62 years old and married with two children, who are now married and working. They all live together in the family home. To make a living, R. built a small workshop from which she sells some foodstuffs, earning around $5 a day. She lives her husband who has a skill in building wooden houses. R. is requesting a loan to enlarge the current capital of her food business.

loans.use: To enlarge the current capital of her food business

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: 40-year-old Elsie B. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has five school-aged children. Elsie farms and also grows fish – her one-hectare (2.5-acre) land is divided into a rice field and a fish pond. She sells her harvest at the market and around her community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-one years already. In January 2010, Elsie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure and feeds

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Bancomunal Paloma, es conviviente tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 10 años, ambos estan estudiando actualmente. Antonia tiene una tienda de productos variados en su casa, desde pequeña le gustaron los negocios, antes vendía golosinas en un puesto en el Hospital, ahora el negocio lo maneja en casa, asi esta mas pendiente de sus hijos, ellos le ayudan en el negocio los fines de semana.

Antonia tiene 3 años aproximadamente en FINCA Peru, las capacitaciones le han ayudado sobre todo en los temas de cómo atender a los clientes.

Antonia solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la compra de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar al por mayor, cada saco que compra el dura 1 semana en su negocio, es por ello que aprovechará con el préstamo en comprar sacos para varios meses.

El sueño de Antonia es tener un negocio mas grande en su casa, como un bar, y construir su casa de material noble.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Paloma (The Dove) communal bank; she has two children, 13 and 10 years old, who are students. Antonia has a grocery store in her home. She’s liked business since she was a little girl; she used to sell sweets at a stand in a hospital but now runs her business from home so that she can watch over her children better. They help out with the store on weekends. Antonia has collaborated with FINCA Perú for about three years; the training sessions have been very helpful for her especially with regards to customer service. Antonia is asking for a 1200 sol loan to buy grocery items like rice and sugar at wholesale. Each sack she buys lasts a week in her store so she will take advantage of the loan to buy several sacks in order to have stock available for several months. Antonia’s dream is to have a larger business, like a bar, in her home and to build her house out of substantial building materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items at wholesale.

loans.name: Jose Enrique

texts.es:
José Enrique es un joven de 23 años de edad, casado, padre de un hijo, comerciante desde hace varios años, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, oficio que desde su pubertad hace para ayudar a sus padres. Los cuales se dedicaban al comercio.
Cuando las ventas se ponen bajas venden poco y algunos productos que no duran se pierden lo que para ellos es pérdidas. Lo que se hace a veces para no perder es dar mas barato de lo que se compro por docena y así no perder del todo.
Las frutas y las verduras por ser tan ricas y saludables se venden, es cuando los productos aumentan es que bajan, pero es un comercio bueno que día  a día se vende. En ensaladas en bolsa, oh en fruto entero.
Con este préstamo desea aumentar sus ventas, comprara: saco de zanahoria, quintal de papa, quintal de cebolla. Chiltoma, repollo, tomate, dos quintales de naranjas, sandia, melón, banano, pepino, ayote, 
Y más productos. 
Con la inversión se aumenta las ventas comos las ganancias, y este es el propósito que a través de este financiamiento espera alcanzar.
texts.en:
José Enrique is a 23 year-old young man. He is married and has one child. He has been a salesman for many years. He has sold fruit and vegetables since puberty when he began working to help his parents, who work in the business. When business is slow, the family make fewer sales and lose the produce that goes bad, which is bad for their business. To avoid wasted produce they sell produce sold by the dozen at a discounted rate, that way they do not lose everything. They sell a lot of fruit and vegetables because they are both healthy and delicious. When the amount of produce increases, the price lowers, but overall it is a good business with daily sales, whether of bagged salads or whole fruit. With this loan, José wants to increase his family's sales. He will buy a sack of carrots, 46kg of potatoes, 46kg of onions, sweet pepper, cabbage, tomatoes, 98kgs of oranges, watermelons, melons, bananas, cucumbers, hard squash, and other products. With this loan, both sales and revenue will increase, which is the goal José hopes to achieve.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julio Alfredo

texts.es:
Julio tiene 35 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán, está acompañado, vive con la esposa y dos hijos de las edades de 10y 5 años, se dedica al cultivo de la tierra (siembra de maíz y frijoles).
Hace 5 años se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles lo cual lo realiza con su familia, trabaja para solventar las necesidades básicas de la familia, solicita un préstamo para compra de insumos agrícolas que le permita obtener una buena cosecha.
Los sueños son mejorar la vivienda donde reside con la familia, apoyar a los hijos con la educación, mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Julio, 35, lives in Delicias de Concepción, Morazán department, with his wife and two children who are 10 and 5 years of age. He is a bean and corn farmer. He has grown beans and corn for the last five years, a task he does together with his family. He works to meet the family’s basic needs and is asking for funds to buy farming supplies that will make a good harvest possible. His dreams are to improve the dwelling he shares with his family, to provide his children with an education, and to improve the family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Zinunula Development Group-Mpigi

texts.en:
Ten years ago, it was savings from his farming and brick making businesses that facilitated and spawned the establishment of his current commercial motorcycle business in Bujjuko-Mpigi. This is all taken into perspective by 35-year-old Baliza J., as he makes unprecedented progress in his business. 

This cheerful and sturdy father of five says he has been able to live within his means with an income of $14 a week.  While the idea of getting back into full scale farming is alluring, he says he is comfortable doing it on a small scale just now. 

He considers himself somebody who likes to create a relaxed and pleasant atmosphere around other people. He says that attribute has been his strength in attracting customers. 

With this loan, he is looking at diversifying into poultry. He says with this money he is going to buy chickens to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of chickens for reselling

loans.name: Camino Al Triunfo Group

texts.en:
The communal bank “Camino al Triunfo” (The Walk to Triumph) consists of 18 associates from Temuco City. This is the second loan they seek from Kiva lenders. These individuals' livelihoods consists of sales of seasonings (garlic, oregano, and merkén), canned goods, fast foods (fried pies, buns and completos (Traditional Chilian Hot Dogs), lingerie, perfumes, and home décor items (sheets, towels, tablecloths).

Jacqueline can be found in the third row and first from the left; she is wearing a green jacket. Jacqueline´s business consists of a small grocery store located in front of her house.  Jacqueline has managed this store for the past 15 years.  Jacqueline plans to use this loan to purchase merchandise such as perishable and non-perishable food items for her store.  As the market has been getting more competitive, she would like to offer a greater variety and change some of the items she currently offers; for example, a larger variety of vegetables, firewood and charcoal items. 

Even though Jacqueline is affected by thyroid disease, she remains full of life due to her business. Jacqueline's household consists of her mother and her 19-year-old daughter, who also works.  Jacqueline also has an 18-year-old son who is serving in the military. 

What Jacqueline has found most appealing about Fondo Esperanza is that they are quick to inform her about the progress of her loan. 

Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. It is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (the capital of Chile) and is the location for a number of lakeside spa resorts and striking native flora and fauna. This region is also noteworthy for being the region where 50% of Chile's existing indigenous Mapuche community live; some of whom are members of Fondo Esperanza communal banks.

loans.use: Perishable and non-perishable food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim E., 56, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells fish porridge, earning an income of 11 USD per day. One of her children provides make-up services for wedding parties, earning an income of USD 10 per day.

Kim is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Angela Norma

texts.es:
Ángela de 42 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso y caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y  ecología en disolución. Tiene una pequeña papelería. 

Para ayudar con los gastos familiares de su esposo y poder pasar tiempo con sus tres hijos comenzó a vender papelería en su casa a sus vecinos, construyendo la parte delantera de su casa en un local obtuvo ingresos suficientes para surtirla. 

Para continuar trabajando en su negocio ella necesita comprar con el préstamo una vitrinas, papelería y bisutería. En el futuro quiere readecuar mejor su casa y incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
42 year old Angela lives in a suburb called Paraiso, known for its unpaved streets and environmental degradation.  She has a small stationery store.  To help with her family's expenses and be able to spend more time with her three children, she started to sell stationery in her home to neighbours.

Building the rear of her house into a shop earned her enough money to get ahead.  To keep working in her business, she needs this loan to buy display cabinets, stationery and costume jewellery.

In the future she would like to renovate her home and grow her business.

loans.use: Purchasing of stationery and merchandise

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: El Sr. Rigoberto G. G. él se dedica a la siembra de granos como maíz  tiene  treinta años  de dedicarse a esta actividad es casado actualmente. Ha tenido tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de insumo y preparación del terreno para la siembra los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Rigoberto G. G. has been farming grains such as corn for thirty years. He's currently married. He's had three loans with CEPRODEL and he's used each on for the purchase of supplies for preparing the land to be farmed. The CEPRODEL loans have benefited him greatly because he's been able to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of farming materials such as fertilizer, cleaning supplies, ground preparation, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama H. smokes fish for sale at Asenadze near Abura. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a mason. She has been selling smoked fish for the past twenty years. She assists her husband in providing the basic needs of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to buy a plot of land from her additional income.

In this photo Ama is holding a piece of fish she is going to smoke.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Minkailu

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Minkailu B.. He is married, and has four children aged 5, 8, 10 and 12  years. He has eight additional dependents who live with him because they are his relatives and they need him to assist them with their education. They also help in the business.  

In 1995, Minkailu established his plastic slippers business because he believed the business would improve his family's standard of living. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 800000 SLL every month from this business. 

He needs a loan of 4500000 SLL in order to buy additional stock for the business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 1200000 SLL. 

In the future, Minkailu plans to sell wholesale to supply other traders. He also hopes to continue to educate his children to the university level. He is serious and determined. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers for resale

loans.name: Cristo Redentor 5 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is one of the members of a group called Cristo Redentor 5 (Christ Redeemer). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to offer credits to her customers because she has lost capital. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook and relaxing at her home.

Ramona is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She has had her business for four years, which started as a stand offering candies and snacks. Now, she operates a 'colmado,' a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food. Normally, colmados are in the same neighborhood within a short walk from any home.  

She plans to use this loan to buy rice, flour and other foods. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save.

This Esperanza associate began borrowing because she needed capital for her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry. The main economic activities are a free trading zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas in the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour and oil

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 32 years old and is married with two children who are 6 and 11 years old.   Her husband works as a driver.  She lives in the Gasabo district where she owns a well-organized shop, selling a variety of goods. Her business is open from 5am until 8pm every day and she has been in this business for six years.

Clementine has requested this loan to purchase a large stock of goods to sell.  She will use any profits to continue to develop and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Samer

texts.ar:
سامر في عمر 34 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في بيع الالعاب والعطورات والقرطاسية له في العمل
اكثر من 12 سنة يحب عائلته ويسعى جاهدا الى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي له ولعائلته التي يلقى منها الدعم
الكامل له تاريخ اقتراضي جيد مع المجموعة استطاع من خلاله الى تحسين مجال عمله وتوسيعه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة
الى زيادة رأس المال في المحل وشراء بضائع جديدة لتوسيع المصلحة يحب ان يتقدم بوضعه الاجتماعي ويطمح ان يوسع
عمله حتى يصبح محل كبير
texts.en: Samer, 34, is married with a son. He has been working in selling toys, perfume and stationery for 12 years. He loves his family and enjoys its full support. Samer  works hard to improve his sociA. and economic conditions, as well as his family's. Samer has a good credit history with A. Majmoua. His previous loan helped him develop his business. He wishes to get a new loan to increase his business capitA. and buy new stock. Samer wishes to improve his sociA. status and expand his business so that he can own a big shop in the future.

loans.use: To increase his business capital and buy new stock

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yesenia, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposo, su padre y dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a vender lociones y cosméticos, este negocio fue por iniciativa propia junto a su esposo desde hace 5 años, iniciando con venta de medicina popular y lociones, pero actualmente solo vende lociones y cosméticos, con un horario de 7:00am a 4:00pm, saliendo a visitar a los clientes y vecinos cercanos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para comprar lociones y cosméticos, con esta compra ella pretende aumentar el número de productos para ofrecer a los clientes, ya que de esta forma podrá vender nuevos productos y generar ingresos para solventar necesidades en su hogar.
Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio, contar con suficientes productos para poder diversificar las ventas ya que los clientes demandan nuevos productos que debe mantener en su inventario para poder vender, con su familia ella espera que a través de su buen desempeño en el trabajo ellos sean beneficiados con mayores comodidades económicas.
texts.en:
Yesenia lives in the city of San Miguel, in the department of San Miguel. She lives together with her husband, her father, and two children, aged 5 and 2. She sells skin lotions and cosmetics. She started this business in partnership with her husband 5 years ago. They started out selling popular medicines and lotions, but now they only sell lotions and cosmetics.  They work from 7:00am to 4:00pm, going out to visit their clients and nearby neighbors.

She requests a loan to purchase lotions and cosmetics. With this purchase she will increase the inventory of products to sell to her clients. She will be able to sell new products and generate more income and meet the household expenses. 

Her goal is to strengthen her business, to have enough inventory to add variety to her sales. Her clients request new products and she needs to maintain her inventory in order to sell. As for her family, she hopes that her hard work will benefit them with greater financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Cathy has a salon business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Cathy has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a dryer and hair oil. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Cathy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to own more branches of her salon business.
Cathy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her the opportunity to learn how to plait hair and take computer studies.

loans.use: To purchase a dryer and hair oil

loans.name: Catherine Mwikali

texts.en:
For six years Catherine C. has been operating a salon and earns a monthly profit of KES.10, 000 in Machakos town. She is married to C. and they have three school going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan with which she plans to buy more weaves and cosmetics. The anticipated profit she will use to meet the family needs and pay school fees for her children.

In the future Catherine desire to really grow her business and own the best lady shop whereby she will be able to sell variety of cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy weaves and cosmetics

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora A. E. Ana Isabel tiene 41 años  de edad  es una mujer muy joven y divorciada, vive con sus dos hijos los dos son menores de edad, la señora llego hasta primaria incompleta ya que no tenían los recursos económicos para terminarlos, es muy trabajadora, responsable, ya que ella es la que tiene que administrar el negocio y su casa
Doña Ana Isabel A. es una persona muy  honrada, con buenos principios morales, doña Ana   piensa  invertir en la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio que es ropa para adulto y niño, también en la compra de telas para hacer bolsos para venderlos y tener mas ingresos, con eso compraría mas mercadería ropa zapatos electrodomésticos. Doña Ana empezó con un monto de 100,000.00 colones y desde hace 4 años. Doña Isabel se levanta muy temprano para ir a dejar su hijo a la escuela y su hija mayor se alista para ir al colegio les alista el desayuno y después se dedique al negocio
Si ustedes podrían apoyarla será un beneficio muy bueno, ya que ella está necesita de seguir trabajando para darle un buen hogar a sus hijos
texts.en:
Ana Isabel A. E., 41, is a very young, divorced woman living with her two minor children.  She did not complete elementary school because her family didn’t have enough resources for her to finish it.  She is very hard working and responsible since she has to run her business and her house.

Doña Ana Isabel A. is a very honest person with good moral principles.  Ana plans to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her business which is adult and children’s clothes.  She will also buy fabric to make purses to sell at affordable prices.  With that she will buy more merchandise like clothes, shoes and home appliances.  Ana started out with a total of 100,000.00 colones four years ago.

Ana rises early to drop off her child at school, and helps her older daughter get ready for high school, and then dedicates herself to the business.

If you could support her it would be a very good b benefit because she needs to continue working to provide a good home to her children.

loans.use: To buy merchandise, adult and children's clothes and fabric to make purses.

loans.name: El Jordan Group

texts.es:
el grupo El Jordan esta integrado por tres mujeres muy unidas y amigas de hace mucho tiempo que trabajan juntas para sacar adelante sus negocios. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Maria Regina N. M. es soltera y se dedica a la venta de golosinas en su casa de habitacion.
la señora Maria vende tacos, enchiladas, pastelitos de perro, tajadas de platano fritas, almuerzos, tortillas con quesillo, cenas y desayunos; al igual tambien vende tortillas al por mayor a algunos restaurantes de la cominudad de Pespire.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de la ricas golosinas.

la señora Esterlinda O. F. es soltera y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, cosmeticos, sandalias, zapatos, bolsos y entre otros, hace sus ventas de manera ambulante.
la señora esterlinda vende sus productos en las comunidades y aldeas aledañas de Pespire.

la joven Kary Magali N. M. esta casada y se dedica a la venta de lazos para hamacas, los productores de hamacas de la comunidad de pespire le hacen los pedidos de los lazos y como es un lugar en donde pasa mucho turista las hamacas se venden muy bien.
Kary se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 1 año.
Kary es una joven muy conocida en la comunidad de Pespire.

el anhelo de las tres integrantes es lograr que sus negocios crezcan cada vez mas.
texts.en:
The group "El Jordan" is made up of three women who have been friends for a long time and are very united. They are working together to advance their businesses. The following gives the details of the various activities that they carrying out:

Señora Maria Regina N. M. is single and sells candies from her home. She also sells tacos, enchiladas, meat empanadas (known locally as "pastelitos de perro"), sliced fried plantains, lunches, tortillas with cheese, dinners, and breakfasts. She also sells tortillas wholesale to several restaurants in the community of Perpire. She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make her delicious snacks.

Señora Esterlinda O. F. is single and sells new and used clothing, cosmetics, sandals, shoes, and purses, among other items. She makes her sales as a walking vendor and sells her products in the communities and villages that border Pespire.

The young Kary Magali N. M. is married and sells ties for hammocks. The people in the community of Pespire who make hammocks give her orders, and since it is an area where there are many tourists, hammocks sell very well. Kary has been working in this business for a year. She is a young woman who is well known in the community of Pespire.

The goal of the three members of the group is to have their businesses grow more and more.

loans.use: to buy corn, tortillas, pork, beef, chicken, vegetables, and churros.

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es: José, tiene 67 años de edad, es originario de la capital Managua localizada a 3 horas y media de la ciudad de Estelí pero fue criado en este departamento, fue casado, su esposa murió, tiene 12 hijos, los cuales viven aparte de oficio mecánico y también comerciante, estudio hasta  sexto de primaria  pues su pobreza no le permitió seguir estudiando mas. Inicio primeramente con su esposa que comenzó a vender productos alimenticios en su casa de habitación, mientras el trabajaba como mecánico, le ayudaba uno de sus hijos a atender la venta, al morir su esposa el se hizo cargo del negocio. Hoy en día la pulpería es su  medio de subsistencia y renta una casa para ayudarse a mantener el mismo  ya que de  todos sus hijos solo recibe ayuda de uno que vive en Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí. Solicito el crédito  para comprar inventario a su pulpería con este crédito espera conseguir mas clientes, tener abastecido el negocio de productos variados, ofrecer un mejor servicio. Tiene planeado comprar un local mas céntrico donde pueda vender todos su productos  ya que el vende en las comunidades cercanas a Pueblo Nuevo en un vehículo   para que la gente tengas mas acceso a productos alimenticios. Tiene como meta próxima abrir una tienda productos lácteos para el municipio de Pueblo Nuevo
texts.en:
José is 67 years old and is a native of the capital Managua, located three and a half hours from the city of Estelí. However, he was raised in this department. He was married but his wife passed away and he has 12 children who live independently and work as mechanics or as merchants. He completed up to sixth grade, but his level of poverty did not allow him to continue studying.

He first started with his wife who began to sell food items at their house while he worked as a mechanic. One of his children helped to attend to the sales and when his wife passed away, he took over the business. Today, the small store is his livelihood and he rents a house, as he only receives help from one of his children who lives in Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí.

He requested the loan to purchase inventory for his store. With this loan, he hopes to obtain more customers, have his business stocked with a variety of products, and offer better service. He plans to buy a more central locale where he can sell all of his products, as he currently sells them in the communities around Pueblo Nuevo from a car so that the people have more access to food products. His next goal is to open a store with dairy products for the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell at his store

loans.name: Rafiqan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan is the wife of K. M. and lives in a small city called Jaranwala in Pakistan. Jaranwala is a city known for its agriculture industry. 

A caring lady, Rafiqan stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. Besides her household work, she also helps her husband in his dairy business. They both get up early in the morning, get milk from the buffalo, and then her husband goes to the community to sell the milk.  In this way, they both generate the income to meet the basic needs of the family.

Rafiqan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s dairy business. Through the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will help him increase milk productivity and also sales.  

Rafiqan is hopeful that through the loan investment, her husband’s business will improve and he will be able to increase his monthly income as well. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rafiqan.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business.

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.fr: Theobard Sinzabwakwira est agriculteur de riz dans le secteur du Ruhuha, membre du groupe Twisungane, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il a 65 ans, il est marie, et il a 8 enfants entre 21 ans et 42 ans.  Il est ne au Rwanda, dans le secteur de Ruhuha, et il a fini 3 ans d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son troisième cycle avec ACB, et il a une très bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat d’urée, NPK, et main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz.  Il voudrait devenir grossiste ou fournisseur de riz dans le secteur de Ruhuha, payer des frais médicaux pour sa famille, et aussi acheter une parcelle pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Theoberd Sinzabwakwira is a rice cultivator in Ruhuha sector, a member of Twisungane, and has been a customer of Kiva's partner, ACB, since 2010. He's 65 years old, married, and has eight children, age 21 to 42. He was born in Rwanda, in Ruhuha sector, and attended elementary school for three years.

He's seeking his third loan from ACB, and his repayment history is very good. He will use his loan to purchase urea and NPK fertilizers, and pay for labour  for his rice cultivation business. He would like to become a wholesaler or furnisher in Ruhuha sector, pay his family's medical expenses, and also buy a lot of land for his family.

loans.use: to purchase urea and NPK fertilizers, and pay for labour  for his rice cultivation business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing and utensils to sell to her cutomers.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 48 years old and has two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Divina has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Divina has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Divina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en: Larisa is engaged in agriculture. She grows vegetables in a greenhouse. The client needs financial means to renovate the conservatory, as it is old and doesn’t serve its purpose any more. The greenhouse renovation and the effort to increase it to the standards will allow Larisa to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions. She lives together with her husband and her son, who helps her run the business.

loans.use: to pay for renovating the greenhouse

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe del Carmen, de treinta y cuatro años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos menores hijas Ruth y Karina, quienes se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de la localidad, Guadalupe tiene instalado un negocio de costureria en la misma casa en donde reside, que es propiedad de un hermano que le apoya facilitándole la misma para que pueda salir adelante con sus hijas, tiene mas de 10 años de experiencia confeccionando diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir, desde una sencilla falda hasta vestidos para ocasiones especiales, ella es muy reconocida en la zona por la calidad con la que confecciona y lo accesible del precio que cobra, a esto se debe su amplia clientela. Guadalupe tiene bajo su responsabilidad todo el cargo de su hogar es por ello que dado que las exigencias en los gastos de sus hijas van incrementando a medida ellas avanzan en sus estudios y dado que Guadalupe desea darles todo cuanto ella pueda y este a su alcance a fin de que culminen sus estudios convirtiéndose en profesionales, ella desea reinvertir en su negocio comprando telas, botones, hilos zíperes para confeccionar ropa que pondrá a la venta y piensa comercializar aprovechando los clientes que la visitan y porque no, pensando en proponerlas en mercado cercano a la localidad de donde reside y a ella le conocen por su excelente trabajo, además tiene en mente instalar en su misma casa una pupusería, son estas las razones por las que necesita el crédito y echar a andar sus ideas.
texts.en:
Guadalupe del Carmen, 34, is a single mother and lives with her two minor daughters, Ruth and Karina, who study at the local school.  Guadalupe is a seamstress and works out of her home which belongs to a brother of hers who is helping out so she can raise her daughters.  For over ten years she has been making different types of clothing, anything from a simple skirt to special occasion dresses.  She is very well-known in the area for her quality work and low prices, and has many customers.  

Guadalupe is responsible for the entire household and she realizes expenses are increasing as her daughters get older.  Since she wants to give them all she can so they can finish their education and become professionals, she wants to reinvest in her business buying fabric, buttons, thread and zippers to make clothing for her customers and maybe even start selling at a near-by market.  Everyone knows her because of her excellent work.  She is also thinking about setting up a "pupusería" (stuffed tortillas), and the loan would help put her ideas into motion.

loans.use: To buy fabric, buttons, thread and zippers for her business.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad is 33 years old and the married father of three children. For the past 22 years, he has worked as a plumber. Ziad started working too young because he had to help his family improve their income and cover expenses. This long experience has earned him the trust and recommendation of his customers.  Ziad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles, and he is a client in good standing. His previous loans have all had a positive effect on his business. 

Ziad is requesting a loan to purchase new plumbing machines and equipment to help him finish his work professionally and in a shorter period of time. He hopes to keep on improving his business and stay healthy to continue accomplishing his business in a professional way.

loans.use: to buy new plumbing machines

loans.name: Laura Estefanía

texts.es:
A sus 20 años de edad y como madre cabeza de familia, Laura Estefanía se vio en la necesidad de trabajar como independiente para generar sus propios ingresos y a su vez estar en su casa para estar al lado de sus dos hijos. 

Es así como esta joven emprendedora se dedica a la venta de mercancía: ropa para dama y hombre, accesorios y productos de aseo personal, entre otros. 

Llegar a tener un almacén con un local propio en el que pueda vender su mercancía es el sueño de Laura Estefanía quien actualmente se ve limitada a crecer por la falta de capital para invertir en más surtido, por eso, esta joven necesita de un préstamo para poder ofrecerle mayor variedad a sus clientes lo que se traducirá en mayores ingresos y una mejora calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
At the age of 20, and as a mother and the head of her family, Laura Estefania found it necessary to work independently to generate her own income and at the same time be at home with her two children.

This is why this young entrepreneur sells merchandise: clothing for men and women, accessories and personal care products, and other items.

Her dream is to have her own store location where she can sell her merchandise. Currently, her growth is limited by a lack of capital to invest in more stock. For this reason, this young woman needs a loan in order to be able to offer a greater variety to her customers. This will translate to a higher income and a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to expand the variety of products that she offers.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de telica, es maestra y está ubicada  en el colegio de la comarca C. de apante, tiene 13 años de laborar, su núcleo familiar  consta de 3 personas que son sus hijos, los que estudian el colegio de la localidad, su esposo trabaja en la empresa agrosa en león, esta señora solicito su segundo financiamiento atraves del convenio con el mismo colegio, los mismos le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, ya que este ultimo lo utilizara para la compra de cemento, hierro, Bloque y Mano de Obra.
texts.en:
This woman is originally from Telica. She is a teacher at a school in the town of C. de Apante. She has been working for 13 years. Her nuclear family consists of three people, her children, who study in the local school. Her husband works at the Agrosa company in León. 

This woman is requesting her second loan through an agreement at her school, which has helped her improve her condition and standard of living. She will use this last loan to purchase cement, iron, cinder blocks and to pay for manual labor.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, cinder blocks and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 35 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She has a business selling bread in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been running this business for three years. Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She can also earn income from selling groundnut paste. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her buy a plot (piece of land).

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Napoleon

texts.en:
Napoleon is married and has three children who are in school. He is 48 years of age and is engage in a farming business where he plants and harvests rice. Napoleon is happy living with his wife and his children, despite the financial shortage encountered by his family.

Because of the high cost of farm supplies nowadays, Napoleon is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for the production of rice. 

Napoleon is dedicated to his work because he wanted to obtain his desire -- to uplift his family out of poverty. He also does his best so he can send his children to school to finish their college education because he is guided by his belief that “education is all a matter of building bridges”.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Lorn (pictured with her loom) is a widow with four children- two sons and two daughters. She lives in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Lorn is a weaver and a farmer. In addition, she supplements a new pig-farming business. She wants to expand her pig-farming business by buying one more female pig, so she decided to ask for a loan for that purpose.

loans.use: to buy one more female pig to raise

loans.name: Julietcar

texts.en:
Julietcar is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Julietcar has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Julietcar is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Julietcar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Las Animas Group

texts.es:
María de Jesús cuenta con 24 años de edad, es casada tiene 4 hijos los cuales 2 se encuentran estudiando Jacqueline está cursando 3º de primaria y Daniel esta en 1º de primaria Eduardo solo tiene 3 años de edad y Raúl tiene año y medio de edad, su esposo se llama Daniel se dedica al campo.
Ella se dedica al comercio vende pollo, pan y cosméticos por catalogo, ella invirtió su préstamo en la compra de pan, pollos y cosméticos como son: labiales, perfumes, cremas, etc. ella dice que su préstamo le ha beneficiado mucho más porque ha sacado su negocio muy bien.

María de Jesús pertenece al grupo las ánimas el cual está formado por 12 miembros las cuales todas son mujeres que a continuación son mencionadas:

Marena cuenta con 27 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende productos de belleza lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los productos como son: cremas, shampoo, labiales, etc. 

Gregoria cuenta con 47 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende pollos lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de pollos para vender.

Gregoria salome cuenta 63 años de edad, se dedica al comercio vende comida, lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza en la elaboración de la comida como son: aceite, verduras, carne, etc.

Ma. Félix cuenta con 28 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende frutas e invirtió su préstamo en la compra de frutas como son: manzana, peras, plátanos, naranjas, etc. 

Ma. De Jesús cuenta con 25 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende pollos lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de cajas de pollos para vender.

Leonarda cuenta con 54 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio de ropa y frutas lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de frutas y ropa surtió nuevos modelos de blusas, pantalones, playeras, etc.

Ma. Victoria cuenta con 27 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende huaraches de varios modelos e invirtió su préstamo en compra de nuevos modelos de huaraches.

Rafaela cuenta 59 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio de quesos e invirtió su préstamo en la compra de quesos para vender.

Evangelista cuenta 43 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio de flores lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de flores para vender.

Maribel cuenta 38 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio tiene la venta de perfumes e invirtió su préstamo en la compra de perfumes, cremas, shampoo, etc. 

Petra cuenta con 59 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio de pescados lo cual invirtió su préstamo en la compra de pescado fresco.

María cuenta con 42 años de edad, ella se dedica al comercio vende verduras e invirtió su préstamo en la compra de verduras como son: jitomate, chile, papa, zanahoria, lechuga, etc.
texts.en:
María de Jesús is 24 years old, married and has 4 children, 2 of which are studying. Jacqueline is in her 3rd year of primary school, Daniel is in the first grade. Eduardo is only 3 years old and Raul is 1-1/2 years old. Her husband is called Daniel and he works at farming. 

She works selling chicken, bread, and cosmetics from a catalog. She used her loan to buy bread, chicken, and cosmetics such as lipsticks, perfumes, creams and other beauty products. She says that this loan will help her a lot because her business is doing very well. 

María de Jesús belongs to the group Las Ánimas (The Souls) which is made up of 12 members, all women, who are mentioned below.

Marena is 27 years old. She sells beauty products and has invested her loan in the purchase of products such as creams, shampoo, lipstick, and other items.

Gregoria is 47 years old and sells chickens and she has invested her loan to buy chickens to sell.

Gregoria Salome is 63 years old, sells food, and she invested her loan in the purchase of supplies to use in the preparation of food, such as oil, vegetables, meat and other items.

María Félix is 28 years old, sells fruit and she used her loan to buy fruits such as apples, pears, bananas, and oranges.

María de Jesús is 25 years old and sells chickens. She used her loan to buy boxes of chickens to sell.

Leonarda is 54 years old. She sells clothing and fruit and has invested her loan in the purchase of fruits and clothing, supplying her business with new styles of blouses, slacks, shirts and other items.

María Victoria is 27 years old and sells various types of sandals and has used her loan to purchase new styles of sandals. 

Rafaela is 59 years old and she sells cheese, and used her loan to buy cheese to sell.

Evangelista is 43 years old and sells flowers and has used her loan to buy flowers to sell.

Maribel is 38 years old, and she sells perfume and has used her loan to buy perfume, creams, shampoo, and other items.

Petra is 59 years old and sells fish and she used her loan to buy fresh fish.

María is 42 years old and she sells vegetables, and she used her loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, chiles, potatoes, carrots, lettuce, and other items.

loans.use: to buy bread, chickens and cosmetics such as lipsticks, perfume, creams, and other items

loans.name: Yessenia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Yessenia de 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres,  cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Chulucanas que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Toda esta zona sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Yessenia se dedica a la venta de cerveza y elaboración, venta de chicha de jora (es una bebida rica elaborada a base de maíz y  muy consumida en el norte del Perú), esta actividad los realiza desde hace un año, ya que es una costumbre que ha pasado de generación en generación. Últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de la chicha de jora y cerveza en la zona donde vive, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y solventar sus gastos personales.

Teniendo la oportunidad de crecer Yessenia a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de cerveza y harina de maíz para la elaboración de chicha de jora, con la finalidad de obtener mayores ganancias y así sus clientes aumenten, para solventar el crédito otorgado y para que pueda seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Yessenia is 22 years old.  She is single and lives in her parents' home, which has only electricity (no running water).  Their home is located in the rural area of Chulucanas district, which is part of Piura department.  Throughout this area, the villagers work in agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

Yessenia works selling beer and making and selling chica de jora (this is a delicious drink made from a base of corn which is drunk a lot in the north of Peru).  She has been doing this for the last year, as it is a tradition that has been passed down the generations.  Recently she has increased her sales of chicha de jora and beer in the area where she lives.  This has been good news for her, as she has been able to increase her income and cover her personal expenses.

Yessenia has requested a loan of 1,500 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa as she has the opportunity for growth.  She will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of beer and cornflour for preparing chicha de jora.  Her ultimate goal is to earn greater income and grow her customers, so as to cover repayments for the offered loan and be able to continue to help her parents out financially.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of beer and cornflour for preparing chicha de jora (a drink made from corn).

loans.name: Vivogbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupement VIVOGBE est formé de douze personnes qui se connaissent de par leurs activités. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Félicienne est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Félicienne est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Godence. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Félicienne assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Félicienne vend des tissus et des chaussures dans sa région ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Parallèlement à cette activité, Félicienne vend des fournitures scolaires. Félicienne achète ses produits au Bénin. C’est la première fois que Félicienne et les autres membres du groupement VIVOGBE sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité et d'accroître leur fonds de roulement, afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The VIVOGBE group consists of twelve people who became acquainted through their activities. Felicienne, the representative of the group, is the one raising her hand in the photo.

Felicienne is 40 years old and is married to a mechanic named Godence. The couple has five children, all under their care. Some of the children attend school. Felicienne and her ​​husband share responsibility for the various household expenses.

Over the past twenty years Felicienne has been selling fabrics and shoes in her area. Alongside this activity, Felicienne also sells school supplies. She gets her supplies in Benin.

This is the first time Felicienne and other members of the VIVOGBE group have sought a credit loan from Alida. This loan will allow them to strengthen their business and increase their working capital in order to better meet their customers' needs.

loans.use: Buy fabrics and shoes.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 35 years old and married with 3 children, ages between 2 years and 7 years. He runs an electrical appliance and movies shop in Goderich, western Area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He also takes care of 1 relative at home. 

Henry has been in this business for 8 years and sells televisions, DVDs, discs, extensions, bulbs, cassettes, fans and switches at his shop. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that his business is doing well.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more electrical appliances. Henry says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his savings and take care of his children’s education. In the future, he would like to open another branch in different locations in town.

loans.use: To purchase more televisions, DVDs, extensions, cassettes and switches.

loans.name: 030807-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Lan has a farm where she raises poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise for sale in the future.

Lan is 34 years old, and she is married with three dependent children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 030807-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Lan joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid two loans from FPW. Lan has been involved in the livestock business for five years. The main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital.

In the future, Lan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lily has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for ten years. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy fish to sell.

Lily has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Cosme Damian

texts.es: El Sr. Cosme es una persona  muy trabajadora  que  se  preocupa  por  brindarle   una buena estabilidad  a su  esposa e  hijos,  el  se acerco  con  nosotros  ya  que  desea  adquirir  una  casa por  medio de  Infonavit  pero  en este  momento  no  cuenta con la cantidad que  le requiere  para   el  otorgamiento  de al  vivienda, agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para   hacer  su  sueño  realidad  el cual  le  permitirá dejar  un  patrimonio a  su  familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Cosme is a hardworking individual who is concerned about providing stability for his wife and children. He approached Credituyo because he wants to acquire a house through the INFONAVIT (government housing subsidy) program, but at the moment he does not have the amount for the down payment that is required to obtain a home.

He appreciates the support provided in order to make his dream a reality so that he can leave an inheritance for his family.

loans.use: to cover the down payment toward the purchase of a home.

loans.name: I Made

texts.en:
Living in an area of dense population, it's become a challenge for I Made. I Made, 53, lives in the suburban areas near the beach in West Bali. He has been running a pig business for almost 10 years. Previously, he lived in rural areas, but three years ago, he moved to the place he lives in now. 

Currently he has 21 fattening pigs, 1 sow, 1 male and a cage, which has a width of 10m and length of 2.5 m. His business is growing because he produces good quality pigs. Because the number of pigs is increasing, they produce more and more dirt as well. I Made dug a hole for drainage. Because the hole was not able to accommodate disposal of the waste, it's become pollution for residents around his house. I Made heard about the biogas program from socialization by MUK at the village office. He immediately joined the program and built a biogas reactor in the back of the cage. Currently the construction of the reactor is in progress. I Made is hoping with the biogas reactor, in addition to reducing costs in the kitchen, pollution to the environment can be overcome.

loans.use: To build a biogas reactor

loans.name: El Penjamo Group

texts.es:
Elsa cuenta con 54 años de edad es casada su esposo se llama Gilberto es campesino tiene una nieta con ella la cual esta estudiando la primaria se llama Maria karleth.
Ella es comerciante vende verduras y legumbres lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de las verduras como son chile. Jitomate, papas, etc. ya tiene 4 años con el negocio y dice que  le va muy bien con su negocio y espera que le ayude ya que quisiera incrementar su negocio.

Elsa pertenece al grupo penjamo que esta integrado por 10 personas las cuales todas son mujeres continuación serán mencionadas: Nelida, Antonia, Maria, Orfelia, Ana, Verónica, Beatriz, Fulgencia, Ma Félix todas realizan una actividad comercial como la venta de ropa, comida, verduras, abarrotes, perfumes, dulces, etc.
texts.en:
Elsa is 54 years old and married.  Her husband, Gilberto, is a farmworker.  He has a granddaughter with her who is in elementary school; her name is María Karleth.

Elsa is a shopkeeper.  She sells vegetables and legumes, so she will invest her loan in buying vegetables such as chiles, tomatoes, potatoes, etc.  She has had the business for four years already and she says that it is going very well for her.  She hopes you will help her because she would like to increase her business.

Elsa belongs to the Penjamo group, which is made up of 10 people, all of them women mentioned here: Nélida, Antonia, María, Orfedelia, Ana, Verónica, Beatriz, Fulgencia, María Félix.  All of them carry out a business activity such as selling clothing, food, vegetables, groceries, perfume, sweets, etc.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as chiles, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo, de 47 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, esta casado con Albina de 47 años y fruto de su relación hoy tienen 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa ubicados en la comunidad de Vista Alegre Alta. Máximo, empezó como agricultor desde muy niño en las tierras de sus padres. Su pasión  por el agro le llevó a adquirir sus propias tierras donde viene trabajando 22 años de manera independiente; en el cual viene cultivando plantas de café. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos de cada producto y de esa manera logra avanzar con mayor rapidez. Se siente muy comprometido con la labor que realiza; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo; hoy disfruta al ver que los frutos de sus plantas le resultan muy abundantes, así obteniendo buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de café que los llega a vender; cuenta que en temporada de lluvias no es de su agrado porque en estos tiempos abundan los insectos así impidiendo el rendimiento de su trabajo y perjudicando a los frutos de sus plantaciones. El crédito solicitado es para que pueda comprar fertilizantes y abono para realizar el mantenimiento de su café y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.  Este es el crédito numero 06 con MFP y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles,  comprara  fertilizantes y abono para realizar el mantenimiento de su café y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en: Máximo, who is 47 years old, is a very hardworking man.  He is married to Albina, who is 47 years old.  A benefit of their relationship is that they have 3 children, and they live in their own home which is located in the community of Vista Alegre Alta.  Máximo began working as a farmer as a very young child on his parents' land.  His passion for the farming world drove him to acquire his own lands.  He has been working independently for 22 years cultivating coffee plants.  During harvest time, he counts on the support of day laborers who see to removing the fruits of each product with quickly.  This way he is able to advance with great speed.  He feels very dedicated to the work that he does.  Thanks to his effort, today he enjoys seeing the resulting abundant fruits of his plant.  Therefore, he is obtaining good earnings for each kilogram of coffee that he sells.  He says that in the rainy season, he is not pleased.  During these times, insects are plentiful and stand in the way of achieving his work, and they are detrimental to the fruits of his plantations.  The loan is being requested so that he can buy fertilizers and manure to maintain his coffee and get a good profit from his fruits in less time.  This is his 6th loan with MFP, and he is dedicated to paying all the dues punctually since he wants to obtain another loan in the future.  In his communal bank, he is a very beloved member.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy fertilizers and manure to maintain his coffee and get a good profit from his fruits in less time.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with five children. 

Mercedes provides the motorcycle with a sidecar where she has a hired driver for her motorcycle. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services.

Mercedes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mercedes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services

loans.name: El Cueto Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias una de ellas es Mercedes quien tiene una pulpería con 25 años de experiencia, es una mujer soltera  con un hijo menor de edad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, productos lácteos, carne de res, carne de pollo, etc. Luz Adilia tiene un cafetín en su domicilio y Juan Francisco recarga baterías de carros , motos y vende aditivos y lubricantes  de automotor.
texts.en: This group is made up of three members.  Mercedes has had a grocery store for 25 years.  She is single and has a minor son.  She will use the money from this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, milk products, beef, chicken, etc.  Luz Adilia has a café in her home, and Juan Francisco recharges car and motorcycle batteries and sells automotive additives and lubricants.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Jordan

texts.en: Jordan M. is private agriculture producer from Sliven. He is 52 years old and before the start of his business has been worked as a supplier in one of the largest factories in the town. Eight years ago he received 11 decares land as a heritage from his relatives and started his business. Now he has a peach orchard garden. Also he grows barley, wheat and Lucerne. His grandfather has always worked as a agriculture producer and Jordan is familiar with this kind of business. This ayear Jordan M. rented another 3 decares land and wants to enlarge his orchard garden. He needs about 1 000 peach trees that will cost $ 2000.

loans.use: To buy 1000 peach trees

loans.name: San Juana

texts.en:
San Juana is a responsible and engaging woman with an enormous desire to pull through with her family. She is 30 years old, is married and has four young children. Her husband's salary isn't sufficient, which is why she decided to start making and selling pizzas door to door. The demand for her products has been increasing and her clients have increased, as have her sales. For this she needs a loan of $250 that she will put towards the purchase of ingredients that she needs to keep expanding her business.

She has struggled a great deal to provide her children with a better education so that they may have a better future and a better quality of life. San Juana and her family needs your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

San Juana es una mujer responsable, emprendedora y con enormes deseos de salir adelante con su familia, tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos menores. El ingreso que recibía su esposo era insuficiente, por lo que ella decidió iniciar con la producción y venta de pizzas que ofrece casa por casa, la demanda por sus productos ha ido en incremento y se han multiplicado los clientes y los pedidos, por lo que necesita un crédito de $250 dólares que utilizará para comprar los ingredientes que necesita y continuar creciendo.

Ella ha luchado mucho para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación para que tengan un mejor futuro y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, San Juana y su familia necesita de tu colaboración, ¡Apóyalos!.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo is a hard-working and responsible woman. Five years ago, she starting selling home products because her husband had left her and she needed to provide for her kids by herself. Little by little, her business has grown, and she has been able to earn more income. It has not been easy for Consuelo to make ends meet as a single mother, but love for her children and the desire to seem them become successful motivates her daily.

Currently, Consuelo is requesting a loan of $250, which she will use to purchase supplies so she can meet the demands of her customers, which, thanks to recommendations from friends and family, are numerous and growing. She plans to repay the loan within three to six months. Consuelo and her children are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Consuelo es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, hace cinco años que inició con la venta de productos para el hogar porque su esposo la había abandonado y tenía que sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola, poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio y ha podido obtener mejores ganancias. No ha sido fácil para Consuelo cubrir los gastos de su hogar ella sola, pero el amor a sus hijos y el deseo de verlos convertidos en profesionistas la motivan diariamente.

En estos momentos, Consuelo requiere de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que invertirá en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, que gracias a las recomendaciones de sus familiares y amigos, ahora son numerosos, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Consuelo.

loans.use: Purchase home products

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Mrs. Bernadina Benitez E. is 39 years old and married. She has 8 children, of whom 7 live with her; they are 18, 17, 15, 13, 7, 6 and 4 years old. Only her 3 youngest children are still in school. The others had to begin working as soon as they finished primary school, to help support the family. Bernadina hopes that the children who are still studying will have the opportunity to go to college.

Her husband is an employee in a local sawmill, while Bernadina has owned her own kiosk for 5 years. She sells all kinds of sweets, fast food and soft drinks. She has a large and loyal client following, since many people come to her kiosk for the exquisite daily menu prepared from scratch by the owner herself. We can mention that the menu includes the typical Paraguayan soup, along with Paraguayan specialities including chipa guazú (a bread roll made from corn meal) and starch chipa.

Since demand for her meals is increasing, Bernadina would like to buy raw materials to be able to meet demand. She is applying for a loan of $400 which she'll invest in the purchase of flour, starch, corn, eggs and meat.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Sra. Bernardina B. E. tiene 39 años de edad, está casada Y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 7 viven con ella; de 18, 17, 15, 13, 7, 6, y 4 años respectivamente; solo sus tres hijos menores siguen estudiando, mientras que los otros cuatros una vez terminada la primaria ya empezaron a trabajar aportando así a la economía familiar pues la necesidad los obligaba, Bernardita desea que sus hijos que aún siguen estudiando tengan la oportunidad de culminar sus estudios universitarios.

Su esposo es empleado de un aserradero de la ciudad, y Bernardita tiene un kiosco de la cual es propietaria hace 5 años; ella comercializa todo tipo de golosinas, comidas rápidas y refrescos. En la actualidad ya cuenta con su clientela bien formada, ya que muchos van al local para comprar el exquisito menú del local, elaborado por la propia dueña. Podemos citar que dentro del menú se encuentra la típica sopa paraguaya, el chipa guazú y la chipa de almidón, que son comidas típicas del Paraguay.

Como la demanda de sus comidas van en ascenso ella desea adquirir materia prima en mayor cantidad para poder abastecer su demanda, por ello solicita un crédito de $ 400 que los invertirá en la compra de harina, almidón, maíz, huevos y carne.

loans.use: Buy flour, starch, corn, eggs and meat

loans.name: Gulkhar

texts.en: Gulkhar is a low-income local from Baku. She is married with 3 children, and she is 47. She has been running her animal business for 8 years. She used her own resources to start this business. Previously she had two loans amounting to $300 and $650 from Normicro and used them for business expansion. Now she is applying for a loan of $1,100 to expand her business further to make more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy 2 cattle for breeding

loans.name: Timotea De Los Santo

texts.en:
Timotea is 27 years old and has five children (two boys and three girls). The three eldest attend the local public school. Her husband sells fish.

Timotea has been selling cosmetics for more than six years. She runs the business from home and has many loyal customers. She purchases the goods at Villa Consuelo in Santo Domingo, a well-known supplier of quality goods at reasonable prices.

Timotea has applied for a loan to expand her business. She wants to purchase fingernail polish, hair lotion, shampoo, skin lotion, perfumes, lipstick, makeup, and other cosmetics in bulk. She thinks that Christmas is a very good time to increase sales volume and get new clients. With the loan, she will buy cosmetics and offer them for sale at very attractive prices. In this way, she hopes that many people will get hear about her business and possibly become her customers. Additional income will help her improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy big cosmetics in bulk to sell during the Christmas season

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kossi A. is 35, married, and the father of two children. He has a carpentry workshop with machines that plane lumber. To meet the needs of his clientele, Mr. A. would like to open a sales point for planks in his workshop. This business will generate supplementary income which will allow Mr. A. to hire two additional employees. His increased income will also permit him to better meet his family's needs.

Mr. A. is a dynamic person and is well versed in this business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Kossi est agé de 35 ans , marié et père deux 2 enfants. Il a un atelier de menuiserie avec des machines qui rabotent . Pour satisfaire sa clientèle Monsieur Kossi A. désire mettre en place un dépôt de vente de planche dans son atelier. Cette activité va engendrer les revenus supplémentaires qui permettront à A. de recruter deux employers supplémentaires. Son revenu va augmenter sensiblement pour faire face aux charges familliales.

Monsieur A. est dynamique et connaît parfaitement le secteur.

loans.use:
to buy 450 planks at Badou that he will retail in the local market of Kpalimé

acheter 450 planches à Badou pour les revendre en détail sur le marché local de Kpalimé

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel lives in his own home on Moxos street in the tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. He is 70 years old and he lives only with his wife. The work that he does is making men’s and women’s suits, since he is a tailor. With this activity he supports his wife and covers his needs. The loan that he requests is to buy fabric, threads and other supplies.

His previous history qualifies him as a good client and one can agree to a new loan. He has already been a client of IMPRO since the year 2003 with an excellent repayment record.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Fidel vive en casa propia en la calle moxos de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 70 años y vive únicamente con su esposa, la actividad que realiza es la confección de trajes de varón y de mujer ya que es sastre, con esta actividad mantiene a su esposa y cubre sus necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para comprar tela, hilos y otros.

Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2003 con excelentes antecedentes de pago

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and supplies for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera A. is 31 years old and married with 3 children. She is a leader of her group in LAPO. She sells Akpu (local dish made from cassava) & plastic wares. She has been in business in since 2005. She is a LAPO client, and needs a loan of $850 to buy more cassava for the production of Akpu, as well as general provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy general provisions and cassava (a plant with edible starch-filled roots) to make local dishes

loans.name: Asha's Imani Group

texts.en:
Asha is 27 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 5. Asha is a "bites" seller, a business she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Mohammad Nasir

texts.en: Mohammad Nasir lives in District 5 of Kabul Afghanistan, where he is married and the father of two children. Although uneducated, he has extensive experience in agriculture and a large amount of cultivatable land. This is the season in Afghanistan when preparations for planting are underway, and because he wants to expand his business, Mohammad is requesting a loan to increase his agricultural stock. The increased income will help make the lives of his family members better, and will make possible the future education of his two sons.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand his agricultural stock

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy I. is married with 4 children. She is 54 years old. She has been borrowing from LAPO micro finance for the past 7 years. She sells rice and river fish. She has been in the business for 8 years. She is soliciting the loan of $450 to buy more bags of rice and river fish. This loan, she said, will help her meet the high demand of her numerous customers and also increase her profitability. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more rice and river fish

loans.name: Thy Yin Group

texts.en:
Four members in Ka Art Village make up a group loan; Mrs. Thy Y. is the group leader. She is a coal seller in the village. Her business is now more improved so Mrs. Thy Y. needs to expand her business in order to make the family more successful. Thus, Mrs. Thy Y. asked for a loan to buy more coals to re-sell.

Her husband, Mr. Sothearou Krouch, is a coal seller and lottery seller. Mrs. Thy Y. is 24 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending a local school while the other is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Thy Y. obtained a loan to start a coal business.

loans.use: To buy more coals to re-sell for an income.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim D. is a farmer who lives with her husband in Trach Village, Kampong Thom Province. She has been farming for twenty-nine years and makes about $3 per day. She works hard every day because she is responsible for supporting her family, which includes four children. The cost of living is increasing, so day to day her family faces high expenses. To support the family sufficiently, her two daughters work as garment workers.  Their combined income is $4 per day. Every year D. rents buffalos to plow her farmland.  Now she wants to own buffalos to use personally. She is asking for a loan to purchase two buffalos to use for her farmland. The loan will allow her to eliminate the cost of renting other buffalos.

loans.use: To purchase two buffalos to use for her farmland

loans.name: Mariama Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mariama S. is married with 4 children in her care, all of whom go to school. With this loan, she would like to improve her family’s living and health conditions; she would especially like to provide good schooling for her children. She is going to buy large quantities of palm oil at Diaobé’s weekly market and sell it retail in Ziguinchor. She plans to repay this loan after six months in one lump sum.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Mariama S. est mariée et a 04 enfants en charge, tous scolarisés. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille mais surtout permettre une bonne scolarité à ses enfants. Elle va acheter en grande quantité de l’huile de palme au marché hebdomadaire de Diaobé et revendre le produit en petit détail à Ziguinchor. elle compte rembourser ce prêt au bout de six mois en une seule échéance .

loans.use: to buy and resell palm oil

loans.name: Tanja

texts.en:
Tanja was born in 1982 and she is not married.  Her monthly salary is 800 KM.  This is her second  loan from WWI and she is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 KM ($600). 

Her wish is to start making cookies in her home and she will use the loan to buy the materials for this enterprise. From the sale of her baked products she will earn additional money for her household.

loans.use: To buy material for cookies.

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth O. is a hair stylist that makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She also sells bags, clothes and shoes. She is single and is 27 years old. Loveth is also a part time student at the University of Benin. She requests a loan amount of $600 to buy more hair extensions, shoes, clothes and bags to sell. She travels to Lagos and Onitsha to buy all of her products. Loveth is grateful to all Kiva lenders and thanks them.

loans.use: To buy more hair extension, clothes, shoes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mr. Sun S. is a villager in Tuol Daoung Kaing village in Kandal province.  He and his wife have a plot of land where they cultivate rice to earn a living.  In this plantation, they now face a small problem because they do not have rice seeds to cultivate.  So, Mr. Sun S. is requesting a loan for this purpose, and he will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizers and fuel to support his field.  He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions after he sells the rice he produces. 

Mr. Sun S. is 39 years old and the father of eight children, two of whom help their parents on the plantation, while another three are attending the local school.  The remaining three are too young to work or study because that they are at the ages of one, three and five years old.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel to support his field.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el Jr. Sucre Nº 998, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali.
