Tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, una mayor de edad y dos que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de albañilería. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. Tiene 4 años trabajando con el banco comunal.  

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de comida en el patio de su vivienda. Todas las mañanas vende desayuno a sus clientes.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 3 kilos de arroz, 5 docenas de huevos, 3 kilos de pescado, verduras, etc.

Hilda se siente contenta porque ha conocido mujeres trabajadoras y responsables para el trabajo.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the "Bellavista" Community Bank, located at Jr. Sucre Nº 998, district of Callería, province of Coronel Portillo, suburb of Ucayali. She is 47 years old, and is the mother of 3 children, one of which is grown, and the remaining two still live with Hilda. Hilda's husband works in bricklaying. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 Hilda decided to begin selling sweets. She has been working with the community bank for 4 years. Currently she relies on selling food out of her home as her source of income. Each morning Hilda sells breakfast to her clients. With this loan of S/. 2,200, which will be repaid in 5 months, Hilda will purchase 3 kg. of rice, 5 dozen eggs, 3 kg. fish, vegetables, and other foods. Hilda is happy because she has met hardworking and responsible women.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 kg. of rice, 5 dozen eggs, 3 kg. fish, vegetables, and other foods.

loans.name: Mr. Ly Math Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The seventeen members of the group live in Svay Bakav village in Kampong Chhnang province. Each member will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mr. L. M. is a village bank president and group leader. He is 58 years old and the father of five children. Three of his children help on the famiL. farm while the remaining two attend the local school. Mr. L. M. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice for a living. However, he does not have enough money to buy rice seeds this season.  He is therefore requesting a loan to buy them. The loan will also allow H. to purchase fertilizer to increase his crop yield. His wife, Mrs. Sman L. Sas, helps H. on the farm.

This is a village bank loan consisting of end-of-term loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier than the end of the term if they are financialL. able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Azra Ibrar Hussain Group

texts.en:
My name is Azra. I am 49 years old and married. I live in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. I own a two room brick house in the city where I have lived for the past 25 years. My husband's name is I. H.. He is a driver by profession. He drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) and has 15 years of experience. I am a mother of six children: three sons and three daughters. My eldest son is an electrician. My middle son works in an office. My youngest son reads in 2nd standard. My eldest daughter reads in 3rd standard. My middle daughter reads in 2nd standard. My youngest daughter reads in kindergarten.

It’s my wish to give my children a good education, because I truly believe that education is the key to success. If a person takes advantage of education they can achieve their goals. To achieve my wish, I earn money with the skill of sewing clothes. I get orders from my relatives and my neighbors. I have used the income to pay the school expenses for my children.

I am applying for a loan to buy repair tools for my eldest son, so that he is able to repair electrical items easily.

I am a group leader of some women in my locality. Nasreen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to resell. Zaitoon baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy repair tools to repair electrical items

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: HUMBERTO TIENE 42 AÑOS DE EDAD, EN SU CARNET FIGURA COMO SOLTERO , TIENE UN HIJO, TAMBIÉN TIENE UNA VIVIENDA QUE ES PROPIA UBICADA EN VILLA FATIMA. HUMBERTO TRABAJA EN LA GRANJA MROCHEK COMO PORTERO, ADEMAS TIENE INGRESO POR PELAR POLLO EN LA MISMA GRANJA, LA CODEUDORA TRABAJA COMO EMPLEADA DOMESTICA EN UNA CASA PARTICULAR. HUMBERTO TIENE BASTANTES AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN EL RUBRO. LA COMPETENCIA ES BAJA PORQUE SI BIEN EXISTEN OTRAS GRANJAS, TAMBIEN HAY BASTANTE DEMANDA. EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO ES PARA COMPRA DE MOTO PARA TRANSPORTARSE A SU TRABAJO. EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGO Y INFOCRED NO PRESENTA ASPECTOS NEGATIVOS Y EN AGROCAPITAL HA SIDO EXCELENTE CLIENTE CON MORA CERO.
texts.en:
Humberto is 42 years old, single, and has one son. He also owns a house in the town of Fatima. Humberto works as a caretaker on a farm, Granja Mrochek, and also earns an income plucking chickens at the same farm. The cosigner on this loan works as a domestic servant in a private home. Humberto has many years of experience in his area of work. Competition is low because even though there are many other farms, the demand is quite high for workers. This loan will be used to buy a motorcycle to use as transportation to and from work. He does not have any negative credit history according to the Risk Center and the INFOCRED Bureau. He has been an excellent client of AgroCapital and has never defaulted on a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Motorcycle

loans.name: Corazon De Maria Group

texts.es: El grupo "Corazón D. Maria" es un grupo muy unido y representado por la señora Nancy, ella al igual que sus compañeras resiD. en resiD. en el barrio las Gramas donD. todas se conocen d varios años, Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco familiar entre la señora Nancy y Maria del Carmen las cuales son hermanas pero con ingresos independientes. La mayoría D. las socias se dedica al comercio D. productos como cosméticos, pan ropa, refrescos, comida, abarrotes, dulces y al transporte público D. pasajeros. Dentro del ámbito comercial siempre existe la competencia es por eso que se debe D. contar con productos D. buena calidad y con una buena calidad humana para no perder clientela y poder D. esa manera llegar con el pan D. cada día a sus hogares. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos y materiales para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Las socias no cuentan con mucha experiencia en grupos solidarios pero conocen la responsabilidad que implica un financiamiento y no quieren fallar a la Fundación agrocapital quien confía en su capacidad y honestidad.
texts.en:
The group "Corazón D. Maria" (Mary's Heart) is a very united group represented by Nancy. She, like her partners, lives in the Gramas neighborhood where everyone has known each other for many years. Within the group. there is a familial relationship between Nancy and Maria del Carmen - they are sisters, but with independent incomes. The majority of the members sell products like cosmetics, bread, clothing, drinks, meals, groceries, sweets and transportation. With commercial success, there always exists competition, which is why they should rely on good quality products and with good quality workers so as not to lose clients and proviD. for their families. The purpose of this loan to buy supplies and materials to increase their sales, improve their profits, and proviD. their families with a better quality of life. The members do not have much experience with support groups, but they know the responsibility that it entails and they do not want to disappoint the Fundacion Agrocapital who trusts in their ability and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth T. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high.  She has sold clothing and made funeral decorations at Komenda Junction near Elmina, since 2001. Her husband is a trader. Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.  She will use the loan to increase her sales of clothing and funeral decorations to meet the increase demand of her customers.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save towards a house she wants to put up with her husband.

loans.use: Increase the sale of clothing and funeral decorations to meet increasing customer demands.

loans.name: Kafakh Group

texts.fr:
http://sem-fund.org/carabane.php

Nous avons fini de rembourser le premier prêt que vous nous avez accordé. Nous sommes très satisfaites et sommes venues demander à ce que cela soit renouveler, car avec ce que vous nous avez preté, nous sommes parvenues à travailler pendant toute l'année et nous avons réussi à aider nos enfant à prendre en charge leur scolarité sur le continent; Comme vous le savez, notre écovillage est très enclavé et l'accès est très difficile. C'est grâce au prêt que Kiva nous a accordé que nous avons affronter l'année scolaire de nos enfants avec beaucoup de sérénité et moins d'angoisse. Les bénéfices que nous avons tiré de l'activité précèdante nous a beaucoup soutenu. Bien que nous ne sommes pas parvenues à faire des économies; nous avons quand même pu faire face aux besoins élémentaire de nos familles. Nous comptons donc reprendre le commerce des différents produits que sont transformés ici et de vendre des ustensiles dont les populations ont besoin.
texts.en:
http://sem-fund.org/carabane.php We have finished reimbursing the first loan that you gave us. We are very pleased about that and have come to ask you to renew the loan. With the sum you loaned us, we managed to work the whole year and we were able to pay our children's school fees.

As you know, our eco-village is off in the country and hard to reach. Thanks to the Kiva loan we were able to face our children's school year with serenity and less anguish. The profit that we made from our former business sustained us.

Although we did not manage to put by any savings, we were at least able to cater for the basic needs of our families. Thus, we intend to take up a business selling different products that are produced here and sell the utensils that the inhabitants need. Note: one member of our group, Rokhaya G., was not present for the photo

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of household merchandise and  sale of ocean and forest foods

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 25-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region. Ahmad has owned a barber shop for a year. Ahmad has requested a loan of $1,500 from A. Majmoua so as to decorate his salon. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad sees himself as speciA. in his business because he knows how to treat his clients and because he is aware of new hairstyles. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ahmad began his business because he had prior experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To decorate his salon.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат Эгамбердиева женщина 42 лет,замужем, мать 3 детей.Проживает саодат в Зафарабадском районе, недалеко от рынка Бадахшан, на котором она торгует детской одеждой.
 Супруг Саодат Шукуров Исматулло работает водителем. 
 Уже более 2 лет, Саодат занимается предпринимательской деятельностью, которая приносит прибыль в ее семью. 
 Саодат запрашивает сумму в размере 4000 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев, для товарооборота.
 На полученную часть прибыли от продажи хочет построить дома курятник и завести кур. Уходом за курами будут заниматься ее дети.
texts.en:
Saodat E. is a 42 year old woman; she is married and is the mother of 3 children. Saodat lives in the Zafarabad region not far from the Badahshaman market where she sells children’s clothing. Saodat’s husband, Shukurov Ismatullo works as a driver. Saodat has been an entrepreneur for more than 2 years and this brings profits to her family. Saodat would like to borrow 4000 somoni for turnover. She would like to use her sales profits to build a henhouse at home and to raise chickens. Her children will take care of the chickens.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For turnover

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda I. is a pig grower. She is 55 years old and has twelve children. She started her business with only one pig but, through the help of her husband and CEVI, she managed to grow and sustain her business all the more. The income she gets from her piggery is what she uses to pay the tuition of her children in college. She also wants to expand her pig business in the future. She would like to ask for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase pig feed. She believes that her loan will give her a better chance to improve her livelihood. CEVI helps small businesses to grow. It provides not only loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is hoping to obtain additional working capital of PHP 8,000 to have sufficient capital in her vending business. By working hard for them, she wants her family to experience the fullness of life.

Virginia sells snack refreshment such as “halo-halo” which is a mixture of different fruits, milk and crushed ice. She is happy that her husband supports her by utilizing his skills in carpentry in a furniture shop business where he is employed. She hopes that through seeking help for the growth of her business from a microfinance organization, she can provide sufficient needs for her family, especially the educational needs of her youngest child.

Virginia is already 42 years old. She is married to Ronilio S. and is blessed with two children. Their eldest is April who is now married at the age of 23. She did not finish college studies because of her early marriage. The youngest is Josiefat, who is now 18 years old and still studying. Virginia hopes that her youngest child will pursue her studies until she finishes college. Virginia is always willing to do all her best just to provide for all the needs of her children.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Sara M. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children, between the ages of 1 and 10. Sara has been running a clothes shop since 2002. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Sara currently earns about 80 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to increase the size and range of her business. Sara thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothes for her business

loans.name: Rosario Florinda

texts.es: Doña Rosario T. tiene 28 años de edad, es casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Ropa Típica”, habita junto  a su esposo e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de laborar en el comercio   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Xolcaja del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Doña Rosario T. is 28 years old and lives with her husband and children. She is a merchant who sells traditional clothing. She and her husband work in the same shop with their two employees. For the past 8 years, they have been operating their business from home in Paraje Xolcaja in the Poxlajuj sector of Totonicapán District, Guatemala.

Now that customer demand has increased, they are not in a financial position to increase their capital. For this reason, they have approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan. They intend to buy raw materials needed to increase their sales. Doña Rosario hopes that her family will get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Bitrice

texts.en:
Bitrice is a member of the Amani borrower group in Kinyanambo,Iringa,she is 37 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 18,13 and 10 years.

Bitrice started her own food business selling bites 2 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 80,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Beatrice first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,She requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more cooking oil,wheat,sugar.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Bitrice  hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat

loans.name: Rein

texts.en: Mrs. Rein K., who lives in Thnous Village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding  business is doing well, she wants to expand by purchasing ten more piglets and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Keo Korn, a blacksmith, is shown on the right in the photo. This couple has four children, two employed in a garment factory while the others do housework at home and help with their parents' work.

loans.use: To buy ten more piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: Roger Antonio A. M. tiene 31 años. Es un hombre muy responsable vive con su compañera de vida. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar servicio de reparación de vidrios automotrices. Hace más de 6 años que inicio con este negocio con ahorros que tenia, por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a brindar los servicios de construcción todos los días Roger trabajaba y tenía que transportarse en una bicicleta pero debido a que los lugares a los que iban eran muy lejanos y pasaba mucho tiempo lejos de su familia, por lo que decide establecer su propio negocio y así con el tiempo fue adquiriendo clientes. El solicita el financiamiento para la compra de herramientas para su negocio. El deseo de Roger es terminar de construir su humilde vivienda.
texts.en:
Roger Antonio A. M. is 31 years old. He is a very responsible man who lives with his partner in life. He provides auto glass repair services. Roger started his business 6 years ago using his own savings. He was previously in the construction business and had to travel to distant places on a bicycle. Because of his work, he was forced to spend a lot of time away from his family, so he decided to start his own business. Over time, he has been able to acquire customers.

The loan Roger requested will be used to buy tools for his business. He hopes to finish construction of his modest home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools for his auto glass repair business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Rosa es soltera, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Rosa tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa juvenil, además en campaña escolar vende útiles escolares.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y casacas.
Los sueños de Rosa son comprar un mototaxi y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Alborada Communal Bank. Rosa is 50, single, and has two children. Rosa has a stall in the 12 de Abril Market where she sells children’s clothing. Also, she sells school supplies during the school year. Rosa needs a loan for 2,400 PEN to buy pants and jackets. Rosa’s dream is to buy a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants and jackets

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine K. sells fresh fish in Abotoase. She is married and has four dependents. Her husband is a trader. Justine did not receive any form of formal education.

Justine has been selling fresh fish for ten years and helps her husband to pay the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to be processed for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to be processed for sale

loans.name: Zundui

texts.en:
D. is 39 years old and lives with her aunt and two sons in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of her sons, ages 18 and 16, attend a local high school. Her aunt stays at home and Daariima supports the entire family by operating a clothes-making business. 

She began her business in 2003 after working as a dressmaker for several years. At first, she only had one sewing machine and made clothes according to her customers’ specifications. Now she owns many different sewing machines and designs and sews the clothing according to her own tastes. Because of her beautiful designs and the quality craftsmanship of the clothes, Daariima has a large, loyal customer base. She says, “All I want is to grow my business in order to be able to pay my sons’ tuition so that they can have the best education possible.” D. is requesting a 4,200,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of fabrics, materials, and tools for her business.	

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of fabrics, materials, and tools for her business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a local supplier of palm fruits and palm oil. She is also a petty trader selling in the community market square. She sells items like cooking oil, pepper, spices, smoked fishes, etc. on a tabletop in the market. She gets stock from the Kumasi Central Market which is in a nearby city and vegetables from the surrounding communities.

Palm oil is produced from palm nuts fruit. The palm fruit is processed through various stages to obtain palm oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries as well as local soaps. Abena supplies palm oil to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to buy stock in bulk. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of palm fruits and other foodstuffs.

Abena is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children. One of her children attends school but she could not send the others to school; they are now learning a trade. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, spices, pepper, cooking oil, palm nuts fruit, etc.

loans.name: Heriknaz

texts.en:
Heriknaz A. lives in Yerevan with her husband, sister-in-law, and her school-age son. Heriknaz worked in a self-service store as a cashier, and then she worked in shoe factory. In 1991 Heriknaz and her husband left Armenia for Bulgaria where they managed their own shop. After 5 years they have returned home and Heriknaz has started her business renting a space at the trade fair. Her husband is now working at “Ashtarak milk” organization as a mechanic.

Heriknaz sells toys, including mechanical, musical, and educational toys. Now she is requesting a loan of US$ 900 to buy a lot of toys for her shop in view of the New Year's holidays. With the future income Heriknaz hopes to be able to have mixed products in her shop.

loans.use: To buy a lot of toys for her shop

loans.name: Herna

texts.en: Herna S. is from the village of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Herna owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month. In 2007, Herna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Herna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en:
Enhbaatar B. is 30 years old and is not yet married. He lives with his mother in Tuv province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He currently has a girlfriend and plans on marrying soon.

Enhbaatar has a small farm with nineteen milking cows. He started his farming business in 2007 with only eight milking cows. Since then, his mother helped in his business and he has been able to expand the business by adding eleven more milking cows. As he expanded his small farm, he also added two more full-time employees to take the additional responsibility.

Enhbaatar hopes to expand his farm to have at least fifty milking cows. He says that there is overwhelming demand for milk, especially during cold seasons when the milk price peaks and more than triples that of the summer. He further says that he would like to make his farm an exemplary one in the region.

Enhbaatar requests a loan to purchase more hay and other necessary nutrition for his cows.

loans.use: To purchase more hay and other necessary nutrition for his cows

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Maria Del Socorro tiene 49 años, esta señora ha logrado aprender muchos negocios y esto le ha proporcionado una amplia experiencia. Su actividad económica es la venta de frijoles cocidos y tamales hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, y no le fu muy fácil ya que ella no tenía el capital necesario para obtener muchos clientes,  pero esto le ayudo a prender de otros negocio y logro recoger lo suficiente para dedicarse a esto. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de un quintal de frijoles y tamales ya que en su vecindario es famosa por su venta. Su deseo es establecer una tienda y que su hija finalice sus estudios.
texts.en:
Maria Del Socorro is 49 years old. She has been able to learn many businesses and gain a wealth of experience. Her current business is selling cooked bean and tamales and has been doing this for more than five years. Getting started was not easy since she did not have the capital needed to attract many customers. The knowledge she gained from working in other businesses helped her to persevere.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan in order to buy a quintal (100 kg) of beans and ingredients for making her famous tamales. Maria would like to establish a store and see her daughter finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans & ingredients for making tamales

loans.name: Flor De Caliri Group

texts.es:
FLOR D. CALIRI es un banco D. emprendimiento que fue formado por socias D. la zona D. caliri que esta ubicado frente al rio Irpavi,las orillas D. este rio ha sido expropiado por personas que trabajan en el lavado D. arena y que luego venden a las distintas empresas como material D. construccion, en su mayoria los pobladores D. la zona se dedican al lavado D. arena para contrucciones, costa D. 12 socias que se dedican a distintas actividades, tienen una mesa directiva que fue elegida en asamblea D. socios, son personas muy responsables y con deseos D. superacion. forman la asociacion:

La Sra. Gabriela es la presidenta del banco D. emprendimiento Flor D. Caliri, esta casada tiene hijos que estan en edad escolar y se dedica a la crianza D. animales y con el dinero del credito comprara alimento balanceado para el engorD. D. los animales.

La Sra Rosmery es la secretaria esta casada y no tiene hijos todavia, venD. cosmeticos por catalogo y le va muy en esta actividad ya que tiene muchos clientes por el centro D. la ciudad que le hacen pedidos, y con el dinero del credito comprara productos D. promocion para despues venderlos al precio normal.

La Sra. Alicia es  la tesorera del banco, ella esta casada y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores, su actividad es D. lavandera, ya conocen como hace su trabajo y es muy requerida en la zona.

La Sra Graciela trabaja como empleada domestica, es soltera y el dinero del credito lo necesita para comprar un refrigerador para su casa.

La Sra. Maria quien venD. masitas, Carmen que se dedica a la venta D. comida, Antonia que venD. ropa en las ferias, Victoria es empleada domestica, Marcelina  tambien es empleada del hogar, Natalia venD. salteñas, Federico se dedica a la venta D. helados, Benito se dedica al traslado D. arena en su volqueta, ellos son todos los miembros del banco Flor D. Caliri.

El dinero del credito lo utilizaran en la compra D. mercaderia y asi poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

Todos los socios estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
FLOR D. CALIRI is a communal bank composed of members from the Caliri area, which is located on the banks of the Irpavi River. The banks of this river have been expropriated by persons who work washing sand that is later sold to construction companies. Most of the inhabitants of the area work washing sand for construction. The bank has 12 members that are engaged in various commercial activities. They have a governing board that was elected at a meeting of members. They are very responsible folks who want to succeed. The association is maD. up of: Gabriela is the group president. She is married and has children who are of school age. She raises small animals and will use the funds to buy balanced feed to fatten up the animals. Rosmery is the group secretary. She is married but doesn’t have any children yet. She sells catalogue cosmetics and does well with this activity because she has many customers downtown that place orders with her. She will use the funds to buy sale items that she will then sell at full price. Alicia is the group treasurer. She is married and has 3 adult children. She is a laundress. Her work is well-known so she is highly sought-after in the area. Graciela is a domestic employee. She is single and will use the funds to buy a refrigerator for her home. Maria sells masitas (little fried turnovers), Carmen sells prepared meals, Antonia sells clothing at the markets, Victoria is a domestic employee, Marcelina is also a domestic employee, Natalia sells salteñas (a kind of food filled pastry), Federico sells frozen treats, Benito transports sand in his dump truck; they are all members of the Flor D. Caliri communal bank. The funds will be used to buy merchandise in order to increase their working capital. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in them upon granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to increase working capital.

loans.name: Segunda Rosibel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo la señora Segunda S. Rosibel, se dedica a la producción de ganado bobino, porcino, y aviar también establece cultivos agrícolas como maíz, ajonjolí y sorgo los que destina para la mantención de sus hijos puesto que tiene tres.
La señora S.  ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a realizar estas actividades las cuales son su fuente de ingreso y sostén familiar.
El crédito solicitado será empleado en la compra de alambre para cerca ya que necesita mejorar un tramo de infraestructura de la finca.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo, Segunda S. Rosibel raises cattle. pigs and poultry. She also grows corn, sesame and sorghum. These are to support her three children. Mrs. S. has spent most of her life doing these activities and they are her source of income and support for her family. The loan she is asking for will be used to purchase wire for a fence since she needs to improve a part of the infrastructure of the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wire for a fence.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elene tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 1 hijos de 3 años a su cargo. Maria tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 8 años, debido a que no tenía suficiente ingresos en su familia y necesitaba obtener un medio para trabajar. En los últimos días la señora ha tenido unos pequeños problemas en cuanto a la venta porque tiene que realizar la venta de manera ambulante. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  lápiz labial, pinturas de uñas, maquillaje, cremas y ropa en general. Su meta es crecer de una manera abundante y si es posible empezar a tener vendedores que viajen a los departamentos a dejar su producto.
texts.en:
Maria Elene is 28 years old and she takes care of her three year old son. She began her business 8 years ago because her family did not have sufficient income and she needed to find a way to work. Recently, she has had a few small problems with her sales because she has to travel door-to-door.

She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of lip pencils, nail polish, make-up, cremes, and clothes. Her goal is to grow her business and if possible, hire vendors to travel to the other areas to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Irma Mariana

texts.es:
Irma Domínguez es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay,  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca,  localidad muy reconocida por su exquisita gastronomía, su cultura, tradiciones, costumbres  y su gente muy cálida y amable,  nuestra socia tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal concibió tres  hijos que se encuentran de 25, 20, 16 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la universidad y su ultima hija en el colegio Sagrados Corazones de la ciudad,  su esposo trabaja como profesor en una escuela del sector y por la tarde labora en una fábrica de ropa como agente vendedor, se siente orgullosa de tener su casa propia ya que es el esfuerzo y sacrificio de toda la  familia.

Irma  desde hace ocho años se dedica a la venta de ropa en un almacén ubicado en su casa, atiende  a partir de las 5 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche porque en la mañana trabaja  en el departamento de tesorería en el Ilustre Municipio de Cuenca hace ya 25 años;  se encuentra en su segundo ciclo laborando con la fundación, con el dinero del último crédito solicitado va a comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, sacos y ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Su meta es  incrementar su  almacén con  mas surtido de ropa  para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Irma Domínguez, 50, is a member of the Yanuncay communal bank. She lives in greater Cuenca, a region that is well known for its exquisite food, its culture, traditions, customs and its warm and kind residents. She is married and has three children, who are 25, 20 and 16 years of age. Her oldest two children are university students and her youngest daughter studies in the city’s Sagrados Corazones School. Her husband is a teacher in a local school and works afternoons as a sales agent for a clothing factory. She is proud that she owns her own home since it is the result of the entire family’s efforts and sacrifices. For the last 8 years, Irma has sold clothing in a store located in her home. She is open for business from 5-10pm because in the morning she is employed by the City of Cuenca’s treasury office; she has had this job for 25 years. This is her 2nd loan cycle with the foundation. She will use the funds to buy pants, shirts, blouses, coats and underwear for women, men and children. Her goal is to enlarge her store with more varied clothing for the entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal is 43 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife, Ononnemeh, is an attendant in the local gold mining company. 

During the day, Baynjargal operates a blacksmith business in his town. He has been operating his business since 2000, and has gained much experience in the previous years. Bayanjargal was a herder with few head of livestock between 1997 and 2000. Bayanjargal is an experienced blacksmith and has a loyal customer base. He has been planning to expand his business and create his own workplace in the future. 

In addition to his blacksmith business, he purchased equipment for beverage manufacturing with his siblings, and is planning to operate a beverage workshop this June to earn extra income. Bayanjargal is requesting a 400,000 tugrug loan to purchase more iron for his blacksmith business.

loans.use: To purchase iron

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widowed lady with three boys and two girls of whom two are in school and two have completed schooling.

Asha sells new clothes and also operates a shop selling cereals. She has been in the cereal shop business for two years and in the clothes business for fifteen years. She also earns income from her rental housing.

Asha wants to use the loan to buy beans, rice, sugar, maize flour and wheat flour. The main challenge to her business is that transport costs are high and cut into her profit.

Asha would like to open another retail shop in future and improve her standard of living as she is currently living in a house with neither electricity nor piped water.

Asha decided to join Yehu because the organization has simple repayments and the clients are taken good care of.

loans.use: To buy more beans, rice, sugar, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha L. is a 30-year-old married woman and she lives in Preal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on and aside from farming, she also is a grocery seller and pig breeder at her home. For her grocery and pig businesses, Mrs. Chantha L. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries and piglets and pig feed to support her businesses. Her husband, Mr. Houn Chhay, is a teacher in the local school where he can receive a small salary to support his family. This couple has two children; one is attending the local school while the younger one is three years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ruku

texts.en:
Mrs. Ruku H. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. It is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in seasonal farming. Mrs. H. lives with her husband and two sons. Her husband Mr. Kul Bahadur H. works in a private office. Her sons are studying in grades 12 and 8 respectively.

Mrs. H. is a wholesaler in the potato business. She sells potatoes cheaply in the local market. She buys potatoes from the Kalimati bazaar, which is one of the famous wholesale vegetable bazaars of the Kathmandu valley. 

She has already taken a second loan from Kiva and has cleared her loan. Now Mrs. H. is requesting a loan in the amount of 30000.00 Nepal rupees to buy potatoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for her business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda S., 41, is making sure that her family has enough provisions to meet their daily needs. Married to Florante S., a taxi driver, they are blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  To this end, Luzviminda has been managing her own tailoring shop for the past couple of years.

Luzviminda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her tailoring shop.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business and to buy raw supplies needed for her shop such as fabrics and thread. She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful. She hopes to start expanding her business in the very near future.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw supplies needed for her shop such as fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen is 54 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 4 children aged 22, 27, 30 and 34. Kellen is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. She has been farming for 35 years and employs one farmhand. Her products are bananas, milk, beans, coffee, and maize which she sells to the local market. She depends on the income from her farming activities to provide for her family's needs.

Her major challenge in farming is lack of enough animal feeds, diseases, and high cost of farm inputs like fertilizers.

Kellen has requested her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 50000 to improve her banana plantation. The profits from this investment will improve her family’s living standards as well as their health, since they will have enough food to eat. She plans to expand her banana plantation from the current ½ acre to one acre and increase the number of her dairy cows in the future.

She says that Juhudi is a good company since it cares about small scale farmers who are not able to acquire large loans from big institutions like banks.

loans.use: To improve her banana plantation.

loans.name: Praxedes

texts.es:
Praxedes es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en e caserio Macuaco del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola situada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en su domicilio desde hace siete años, este negocio es de mucha ayuda para su familia ya que les provee de ingresos estables y también lo es para su comunidad, ya que les provee de artículos de uso diario con los que no cuentan al alcance de la mano.

Praxedes ha trabajado durante este tiempo para poder ampliar su negocio, el desea implementarlo comprando abarrotes para  poder ofrecerles mas oportunidades de satisfacer sus necesidades, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

El es una persona bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Práxedes is a 55-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in Macuaco, Oyotún district, an agricultural area located more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He has a store in his home where he sells groceries and basic needs items; he has had this business for 7 years. It is of great help to his family in that it provides stable income. It’s also of great use to the community in that it provides articles that are of daily use which otherwise they would not have readily available. Práxedes has worked during this time in order to expand his business. He wants to stock it with groceries in order to have more variety available. This is why he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a 1000 new sol loan that will help him reach this goal. He is quite a hard working and enterprising person. His greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman in order to provide his family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Sisa Chela

texts.es:
Sisa Chela S. M. tiene 25 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos que se llaman Fernando y Israel. 

Sisa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Narcisa de Jesús. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.

Sisa se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra maíz, cacao, platano, y yuca. Hace las compras de sus productos en el cantón Echeondia y las ventas de sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas. 

Solicita el credito para su agricultura. El apoyo del crédito mejorara su situación economico. Su sueno es comprar un terreno propio. Un desafío que se ha enfrentado en su trabajo es que tiene plagas en su maíz, una en específico que se llama ¨longosta.¨
texts.en:
Sisa Chela S. M. is 25 years old. She is married, and she lives in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. She has two children, Fernando and Israel. Sisa is a member of the Narcisa de Jesús Communal Bank. There are 15 members in all, and most of them are farmers. She is a farmer, and she grows corn, cacao, bananas, and yucca. She makes her purchases in the Echeondia canton, and sells her products in the Ventanas canton. She is requesting this loan for farming. With the support from this loan she hopes to improve her economic situation. Her dream is to buy her own piece of land. One of the challenges she faces in her work is the pest infestation of her corn. Specifically, one of them is called “longosta” (locust).

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farming

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El señor Daniel es un hombre muy trabajador, el tiene un taller de soldadura y le hecha muchas ganas para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, el requiere de este crédito para construir una barda a un lado de su vivienda, por la seguridad de su familia.  La señora María Antonia se dedica al hogar y al cuidado del único hijo que vive con ellos, ya que todos ya están grandes y están casados.
texts.en:
Daniel is a hardworking man. He has a welding shop and has been lucky enough to give his family a better quality of life. He needs this loan to build a protective wall around one side of his house, which will make his family safer. María Antonia is a homemaker. She takes care of the only child who lives with them; the others have already grown up and gotten married.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a protective wall

loans.name: Jamalat

texts.en:
Jamalat T. is a 34-year-old housewife and mother. Her husband, Tayseer, owns an electronics store in a very good location in Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip. He appears in the photo in the electronics store since Jamalat comes from a conservative background.

Jamalat’s husband started this store two years ago and it is prospering and attracting customers. As the number of customers is increasing he decided to expand his store and purchase more electronics to sell. Accordingly, Jamalat took a $2,000 loan from FATEN to help him expand the store and purchase more electronics.

loans.use: To enable her husband to expand his store

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva N. is a widow  who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   Dressmaking / Sewing , Ready-to-Wear (RTW) Sales and Food Vending businesses. Eva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eva has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4700,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 16,000, which she intends to use to pay for more RTW inventory and materials for her dressmaking businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  

Eva N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and sewing materials

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es: Nataly tiene 23 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus padres y de su pequeño hijo; cada día trabaja para salir adelante. Esta joven mujer es muy trabajadora y actualmente labora en una inmobiliaria en donde se dedica a brindar información y realiza trámites de algún terreno o inmueble que se venda. Sin embargo atiende además otro negocio, en la que posee un puesto de venta de golosinas y gaseosas, siendo su madre quien la apoya en la atención hacía los clientes. Se siente muy satisfecha con lo que hace pues obtiene regular ganancia en ambos trabajos, de esa manera puede mantener sola a su hijo. Nataly trabaja sin descanso, pues sabe que tiene muchas metas que cumplir, es por ello que tiene planeado comprar un motocarro para poder alquilarlo, por lo que espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, ya que quiere terminar de construir su casa de material noble. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Nataly tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería en golosinas y gaseosas, pues quiere abastecer su negocio para que sus clientes tengan mayor variedad para escoger, así espera ganas más.
texts.en: Nataly is 23 years old and lives in her own house along with her parents and her small son. Every day she works in order to move forward in life. This young woman is very hardworking and currently works in realtors office where she offers information and does the paperwork for land or property that is being sold. However, she also works at another business: she has a store where she sells candy and sodas, and her mother helps her to attend to the customers. She feels very satisfied with what she does and gets regular income from both jobs and this allows her to bring up her son alone. Nataly works without rest as she knows she has many goals to accomplish. For this reason, she is planning to buy a car to rent out, and in this way she hopes to improve her income. She also wants to finish building her house. This is the second loan that she has had from MFP and she promises to make her repayments punctually as she doesn't want to be in bad standing with the people who made this loan possible and are helping her to keep working and seeking to improve her situation. Nataly plans to use the loan to buy bulk stocks of candy and soda to supply her store and offer her customers a greater variety of goods. She hopes this will increase her income.

loans.use: To buy candy and other products to supply her store.

loans.name: Jose Augusto

texts.es:
José de 40 años, tiene un taller eléctrico. Vive con su esposa y dos hijas en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil).

Empezó hace 18 años atrás con un taller de electricidad, le llamo la atención esta profesión porque desde pequeño el estudio electricidad y siempre quiso ser independiente con un taller. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Repara todo tipo de aparatos electrónicos como televisores, equipos de sonido, etc. 

Parra seguir con la misma fluidez que tiene en su taller eléctrico el quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas y repuestos para los aparatos eléctricos. En el futuro quiere termina de construir su casa y así darle una buena vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old and has an electrical workshop.  He lives with his wife and two daughters in Primavera de Duran (a peri-urban zone with an endangered environment outside of Guayaquil).

He started working 18 years ago in an electrical workshop.  He was interested in this profession because he has studied electrical work since he was young, and he always wanted to be independent and have a workshop.  He currently works from 9:00am until 8:00pm every day.  He repairs all types of electronics like televisions, sound systems, etc.

To continue having the same flexibility that he has in his electrical workshop, he is asking for this loan to buy tools and parts for electronics.  

In the future, he would like to finish building his house and give his children a good life.

loans.use: Purchase tools and parts

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto M. de 45 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos de 2, 8 y 10 años de edad, junto a  los cuales reside en el departamento de San Vicente. José es un hombre muy trabajador el cual vela por el bienestar de su familia, es por ello que se dedica de lleno a su negocio el cual es una tienda de productos perecederos, negocio el cual esta ubicado en su casa y recibe la ayuda de su esposa en donde juntos trabajan de lunes a domingo. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de poder obtener mayores ganancias y brindarle una vida mejor a sus hijos. José solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su tienda, de manera que pueda tener mayor clientela quienes prefieran su negocio. Él es una persona que se destaca por ser muy trabajadora el cual siempre esta buscando una alternativa más para poder obtener mayores ganancias y así brindarle un mejor futuro a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
José Alberto M. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children (ages 2, 8, and 10) in the Department of San Vicente. He is a hardworking gentleman who looks out for the welfare of his family. For this reason, he devotes himself to his business managing a store where he sells perishable products. This business is located in his house. He has the help of his wife and together they work Monday through Sunday. All of their work is performed so that they can generate more income and provide a better life for their children.

José is requesting a loan so that he can restock his store. This will help him attract more customers who will choose his business. He is known for being a hard worker who always looks for better ways of generating more revenue and providing a better future for his wife and children.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores es socia del bancomunal Nueva Vida, tiene 56 años, tiene un matrimonio D. 39 años, tiene 7 hijos, el mayor tiene 32 años y el ultimo tiene 12 años que actualmente esta estudiando.
Dolores se dedica a la venta al por mayor D. frutas como son naranja, plátano, piña, papaya, mango, etc. La dificultad que ella tiene es cuando bajan las ventas.
El préstamo que obtuvo lo va emplear en la compra D. frutas al por mayor como son mango y plátanos.
Dolores esta contenta con las capacitaciones que recibe en las reuniones D. su bancomunal ya que gracias a ello aprenD. mas. El sueño D. Dolores es poder tener más capital.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the Communal Bank “Nueva Vida” (New Life). She is 56 years old and has been married for 39 years. Dolores has seven children. The oldest is 32 years old while the youngest is 12 years old and currently studying.

She encounters difficulty whenever her sales decline. The loan she received will be used to buy fruit in bulk such as mangoes and bananas. Dolores is pleased with the training she received at her Communal Bank meetings. She is grateful because she has learned a lot. Her dream is to have more capital.

loans.use: Purchase mangoes & bananas

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a businesslady in Kiambu. She operates a grocery shop where she sells onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage and other groceries. She has been running this business for a year and her customers are local residents since her business is located in a residential area. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy two bags of potatoes, two bags of onions and four bags of cabbage. Jane is married and a mother of one. She describes herself as very ambitious.

loans.use: To buy two bags of potatoes, two bags of onions and four bags of cabbage

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used shoes

loans.name: Sandro Francisco

texts.es:
Sandro Francisco B. M. tiene 41 años, Es casado vive con  la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Sandro Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y contar con el bienestar de la familia.

Le gusta realizar deporte.
texts.en: Sandro Francisco B. M. is 41. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He has 4 children. The V.R.C. Jerusalen is located in the Caimito region, belonging to the Puerto Pechiche Parish, in the Pueblo Viejo Canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of corn, rice and gandul beans. They spend much time doing this work. Sandro Francisco works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and gandul beans. He purchases his products in the Garcia and Lopez Markets and sells them in the Vaca Market. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn, rice and gandul beans. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to purchase a plot of land and know that his family is doing well. He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Edy Patricio

texts.es:
Edy Patricio Z. V., tiene 35 años, vive en Unión Libre, vive con la conviviente y con los hijos en el  cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Edy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edy Patricio Z. V. is 35 years old and lives in a civil union with his partner and children in the canton Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. He has 2 children.

The members of the V.R.C Valle Alto are located in the community Voluntad de Dios, belonging to the canton Ventanas. This rural group works in short-cycle agriculture planting corn and rice.

Edy works in agriculture planting corn and rice, he buys and sells the products at windows in the Peña commercial market, and sells at home or at the window market every day.   

He is requesting this loan to plant corn and buy fertilizers and seeds. The support of this loan would help him economically to provide for his necessities. He confronts challenges such as pests, diseases, and variations in climate. His dream is to have his own house. He likes to do sports.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Libertad

texts.es:
La señora Libertad es socia del banco comunal Mujeres solidarias distrito de calleria departamento de Ucayali, tiene 65 años de edad y está casada.
Libertad tiene una tienda de abarrotes muy bien surtida porque todos los préstamos que sacó en estos últimos años lo está invirtiendo en su negocio.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, comprará abarrotes como 3 cajas de leche,  1 caja de mantequilla, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 2 bolsas de fideos tallarín, 2 bolsas de fideos para sopa, 1 paquete de harina preparada, 1 caja de aceite, 5 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 paquete de sal, 2 cajas de galletas, 2 bolsas de caramelo, 1 bolsa de tofi, etc.
La señora Libertad, a los años que tiene, todavía tiene las ganas de seguir trabajando para mantenerse activa, ya que ésto la hace sentirse bien de salud.

Ella nos dice que "...gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha ido mejorando cada día".
texts.en:
Libertad is a member of the Mujeres Solidarias village bank in Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 65 years old and married.
Libertad has a well-stocked grocery store because she's invested all the loans she's taken out in recent years in building her business.
She will use this loan of 3000 nuevos soles to buy groceries such as 3 boxes of milk, 1 box of butter, 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 2 bags of spaghetti, 2 bags of soup noodles, 1 bag of flour, 1 box of oil, 5 packs of toilet paper, 1 box of salt, 2 boxes of cookies, 2 bags of candy, 1 bag of toffee, etc.
Despite her age, Libertad wants to keep working and stay active, since it makes her feel healthier.

She tell us that "...thanks to Manuela Ramos her business has been improving every day."

loans.use: Purchase groceries

loans.name: Gladys Veronica

texts.es:
Gladys, tiene 33 años de edad y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Gladys se dedica  a brindar servicios de Internet y también vende celulares. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más equipos de celulares. 

Gladys pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Gladys is 33 years old and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Gladys offers internet services and also sells cell phones.  She has been in the business for many years and has been doing well.  For such an opportunity she requires this loan to purchase more cellular equipment.

Gladys belongs to the communal bank, "Yahuar Maqui",  of the Arariwa Association.  She is thankful of the opportunity presented to her through this medium and as such, she commits to fulfilling her payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase more cellulars

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, reside en Usulután, tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura, los trabajos fuertes los realiza él, por el momento necesitan comprar abono para sembrar maíz, por lo que solicita un préstamo que cubra dichos gastos.
Esta inversión será una gran ayuda para tener una buena cosecha, pues con los insumos necesarios Blanca y su esposo le darán los cuidados que necesita para que produzca.
Las aspiraciones son con respecto a su trabajo, contar con esta fuente de ingreso por vario tiempo, para salir adelante con sus hijos, quienes también deben estudiar y prepararse académicamente.
texts.en:
38-year old Blanca lives in Usulután with her husband and children. She and her husband earn their living by raising cattle and farming. They work hard, but as they now need to buy fertilizer for the corn crop, they are seeking a loan.

This money will be a great help in securing a good harvest as Blanca and her husband will be able to provide the necessary care to their crops. Their hopes for the future are tied in with their work. They hope that the income from the farm will last for a long time so they can provide for their children who must work hard at school too and do their homework.

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer for the corn crop

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 46 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en casa de sus familiares. Hace más de 19 años se dedica a vender pan en una esquina que es muy transitada por su localidad, desde entonces cada día a partir de la 5 de la tarde empieza sola su trabajo. Por otro lado siempre busca el contacto de panaderías para que se pueda abastecer de panes y salir a vender. Ella posee su propia vitrina y canastas para vender, procura siempre ofrecer este servicio con el cuidado de la higiene y limpieza  por eso son muchos los clientes que acuden a ella. A pesar de las dificultades que ha tenido en su negocio como las lluvias, no ha dejado de vender. Con el tiempo ha visto mejorar su negocio ya ahora su prioridad será el de aumentar su capital de trabajo. Es su séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, en todo este tiempo de permanencia en su grupo le ha ayudado a comprender mas sobre el aspecto financiero y mejorara así su calidad de vida de lo que se siente afortunada de ser una de las integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo en su negocio de venta de pan y con la otra parte comprará una vitrina de un negocio que su esposo y sus hijos venden yeso al por mayor.
texts.en: Ana is 46 years old, she lives with her husband and her 3 children in a family member's house. She has been engaging in selling bread for more than 19 years in a very busy area of her town. Since then, she has been working alone every day from 5 pm. At the same time, she is always looking for bakeries where to buy the bread she then sells. She owns a display cabinet and baskets she uses to sell bread, and she always provide this service caring about hygiene and cleanliness, and for this reason the number of customers she has is high. Notwithstanding the difficulties she has had to face in her job such has rains, she has not stopped selling. In time she has seen her activity improve, and now her priority is to increase her working capital. This is the 7th loan she has requested to MFP; the time spent so far in her group has helped her understand more about finance, thus allowing her to improve her quality of life, and for this reason she fells lucky to be a member of her communal bank. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase the working capital of her bread selling activity, and to buy a display cabinet in the shop where her husband and children sell plaster at wholesale price.

loans.use: To buy more bread to supply her stock and to buy a display cabinet.

loans.name: Maria Félix

texts.es:
La señora Maria Feliz L. tiene ya mas de diez y siete años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de comida. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta invertir en remodelas el local, comprar inmobiliario nuevo y comprar variedad de alimentos para la preparación de los guisados que utiliza para la venta de tacos, que vende en su negocio. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para poder invertir en su negocio y así dar un mejor servicio a su cliente. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para sacar a su familia adelante ya que en el negocio lo trabajan la señora Maria Félix y su esposo el señor  Tomas Llanas.
texts.en: For more than seventeen years Mrs. María Feliz has been making and selling food. She is requesting this loan in order to remodel her business location. She will buy new furniture and the various ingredients she needs to prepare the fried meats that she uses to make the tacos that she sells. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in her business and thereby improve her customer service. She plans to pay off the loan with the earnings from her business. This is also the source of money she has to help her family progress. Both María Felix and her husband Tom work in this business.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and supplies for her business

loans.name: Kisembo

texts.en:
Kisembo A. is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 36 years old and married with four children. 

He is in the tailoring business. He makes clothes and the most interesting bit is that he works with his wife and other casual workers. He has been operating from the Nyaruhanda trading centre for over 10 years and he is able to make 200,000 UGX monthly. 

He also has another source of income, which is the sale of produce, some of which he grows on his farm. He is quick to say that selling produce is the mother business. 

Kisembo is very hard working and his dream is to be able to increase production. He needs a loan to be able to purchase more stock of clothes. He will sell off some of it, but some he will make into dresses for customers to buy.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale and for further tailoring

loans.name: Sasagara Group

texts.fr:
Pascasie N.  est une  commerçante âgée de 45ans qui habite la localité de Mumuri en Commune Makebuko de la Province de Gitega au centre du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme les bananes, la farine et le haricot depuis bientôt 3ans alors qu’elle était cultivatrice avant de commencer ce métier. Elle n’a pas fréquente l’école et est mère de 7 enfants dont 4 maries et les 3 autres sont des fonctionnaires. Son mari, Libérât Ndorere, fait le commerce des produits alimentaires. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant de  grandes quantités de produits alimentaires à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle souhaite être une grande commerçante pouvant fournir de grandes quantités de produits d’alimentation. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Sasagara».
texts.en:
Pascasie N.   is a 45 year old merchant who lives at Mumuri in the commune of Makebuko situated in the Gitega Province of central Burundi. She has been selling food products such as bananas, flour and beans for nearly 3 years whereas previously she was a farmer. She did not go to school and she is the mother of 7 children of whom 4 are married and the other 3 are civil servants. Her husband, Libérât Ndorere, also sells food products.

She requests a Kiva loan in order to increase her capital by buying large quantities of food products for resale to make large profits. She hopes to become an important trader capable of supplying big quantities of food products.

She is a member of the « Sasagara» community group.

loans.use: increase her capital  by buying large quantities of food products for resale  to make large profits.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne S. is 35 years old. She is single and has one son, aged 7, whom she plans to give a good education to the university level. 

Carolyne runs a general store in which she sells such items as sugar, rice, flour, cooking oil, beverages and detergents to the local people. Her business is well known by the name Cashim Enterprise and is located at the busy Khayega market in Kakamega. 

Kakamega is a busy agricultural area known for large-scale production of sugar cane and commonly known as the sugar belt region. 

Carolyne has been running this business for the last three years and has managed to provide employment for one person. She says that this business is profitable. The major challenge she faces is the fact that people in the area do not have a lot of money so they do not buy many items thus locking up capital in the slow moving stock. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Carolyne is using this loan of KES 70,000 to buy more general items to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business into a big supermarket in future. She describes herself as determined and visionary.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, rice, detergents, beverages etc., for resale.

loans.name: Danny

texts.en:
Danny is 32 years old and is a married man with four children. The oldest child is 11. 

He is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del sur. He has been growing rice for 5 years. Danny is also a driver and hog-raiser. He uses his motorcycle to transport people around his community. He raises his pigs in his backyard. Danny works hard to provide for his family. 

This loan will be used to purchase feeds and for motorcycle repair. In the future, he hopes that his children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira is a farmer from a small village in Sachkhere District, West Georgia. She is 44 years old, married and lives with her husband Josef, their 16-year-old daughter and 13-year-old son. Both of the children go to school. Josef is a constructor and works in his and nearby villages when there are orders from villagers. But the major source of income for the family is their vineyard and nut growing – the family has 800 grape vines, used for wine and vodka production. Both of the drinks are sold locally. Also they have nine nut trees and sell approximately 150 kg of nuts in the season. Total average monthly income for the family is approximately 400 Laris. 

With the requested credit Naira plans to purchase a milk cow. She will use the milk for cheese production and sell the cheese together with wine and nuts on the local market. 

Purchase of a cow and the sale of cheese will increase the income of the family. This will allow them to purchase new household goods and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Denge

texts.en:
Denge is a married man with one child. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, Denge has operated a water sales business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of water rationing, thereby not meeting his customers' daily needs. Denge dreams of expanding his business in the future. He plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase carts for use in water distribution. Denge decided to join Yehu because of the efficiency of its loan products.

loans.use: To purchase carts for use in water distribution.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna was born in 1950 in Bolnisi city, Georgia. When she was 20 years old she decided to move from Georgia to Armenia. Zhanna is separated and now she lives with her 23-year-old son, who she brought up without any assistance.

For more than 24 years Zhanna worked as an accountant but she always dreamed about her own business. In 1997 Zhanna set up a clothes trading business. She sells clothes that she buys from Georgia. She runs the business from different rented places during different time periods. Zhanna rents a stall in a clothes trading market in Yerevan.

Thanks to the profit from her business, Zhanna solves her small family’s needs, pays for her son’s education and repairs her apartment. Zhanna is asking for a $3,000 loan to buy a large lot of swimsuits to resell because swimsuits are in great demand during summer holidays. This is Zhanna’s 10th loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a large lot of swimsuits to resell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 25 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar y cuenta con casa propia, ubicada en una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, donde cuenta solo con el servicio de luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 120  familias.

Nancy se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente ganado caprino (cabritos), en algunos corrales situados e la parte superior de su domicilio.
