Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. .

Nancy desea adquirir aves de corral para su posterior comercialización además desea comprar alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Nancy  es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir ampliando su negocio para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy, 25, is married and has three, school age children.  She has her own house located in a rural part of Mórrope District; it’s only utility is electricity.  The place is a small community composed of approximately 120 families.

Nancy raises small farm animals, especially goats, to sell in small corrals located in the upper parts of her property.  She feeds them grains and natural grasses.  When they reach a good level of development she sells them to merchants that frequently visit the area where she lives.

Nancy wants to acquire barnyard fowl to sell and she also wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed to expand her business and earn higher income.  Because of this, she’s deemed it convenient to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 2500 new sol loan that will help her reach her objective.

Nancy is quite a determined and hard working person.  Her greatest wish is to continue enlarging her business to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more barnyard fowl and their feed.

loans.name: Giovanni  Manuel

texts.es: Giovanni  es casado y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 23 a 27 años, vive en Soledad municipio de Colombia con el mayor crecimiento poblacional del país; su actividad productiva deriva del negocio de vender frutas y verduras,  el cual realiza en 3 carretillas, en las que trabajan él y sus hijos. Ellos están distribuidos en los barrios de este municipio,  entre soledad 2000, y ciudadela metropolitana. Su experiencia de negocios data desde hace algunos años,  cuando contaba con 3 carros de mula en un barrio al suroccidente de Barranquilla,  pero al sufrir una reubicación de su vivienda  por la erosión, y se mudarse a Soledad  apoyado por el estado, no encontró espacio para esta actividad y los vendió e invirtió en sus carretilla, que en la medida en que fue creciendo sus negocios logró que sus hijos también trabajaran en ellas. Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, porque requiere comprar en mayor volumen frutas y verduras, pues en la actualidad su insuficiente capital de trabajo no le permite aumentar sus ventas, porque compra diario y en pequeñas cantidades.  Su meta es emprender un punto de venta de verduras y frutas en su propia casa en la cual sería apoyado por su cónyuge, y le representaría un ingreso más para seguir aumentando sus posibilidades de bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Giovanni is married and has three children between the ages of 23 and 27 years old.  He lives in Soledad, the city with the highest population growth in Colombia.  He has a fruit and vegetable business, involving three barrows manned by his sons.  They are dispersed around the city and in the metropolitan area.  He started in this field some years ago with three mule carts in a neighborhood in the southwest of Barranquilla, but he had to leave his home because of erosion and moved to Soledad, with help from the state.  He could not find a space to keep carrying out this activity, so he sold his mule carts and invested in the barrows, and as his business grew, his sons began working with them.

This is the first loan that he has requested from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation because he needs to buy a greater amount of fruit and vegetables; at the moment, he does not have enough working capital to increase his sales because he buys on a daily basis and in small quantities.  His goal is to have a grocery in his own house, where he will be helped by his wife, and which would give him a higher income so that he could keep improving the family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables on a larger scale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is aged 25 and does mixed farming in her hometown area of Kisii, South Rift Kenya for close to ten years. Her farm produces maize and cucumbers which she sell locally. She gets supplementary income from her wholesale business which deals with maize.

Alice made a request of 25,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She still has plans to buy more dairy cows. She believes all these are possible with loan and will also be able to educate her children and provide basic requirements.

Alice says Juhudi is doing a great job in helping farmers but laments about high costs of pesticides and poor markets for the produce, especially milk.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s loading business. He will buy a new donkey cart with the loan, which will allow him to carry a bigger load, provide better quality services to his customers and make more profits. 

She is the mother of five children but none of them is able to attend school due to financial constraints. She is a very active lady and performs her household duties very well. She is confident that her husband will successfully be able to improve the financial condition of his business after the loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proved herself as a very responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en: Paulo is a 34-year-old hardworking man with a child living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For three years, he has been operating a guesthouse and business is still feasible, as he has not encountered any major hardship. His dream is to own a well-established hotel with at least four cottages. Paulo needs a loan to construct three cottages.

loans.use: To construct three cottages.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and six siblings. He has five years of experience working as a construction laborer. He works on a freelance basis, sticking with multiple individual jobs. With his business income, this young man is able to help his father with the household expenses. Today, he is asking to borrow $500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase construction materials. In the future, he is planning to expand his business by opening his own office and working closely with construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lilia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from buying and selling pigs. Lilia is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her business.
Lilia has been sustaining her business activities with her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; La socia tiene 56 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 31,28,26 años de edad, la socia tiene un restaurante el cual ella misma administra y lo atiende, la socia prepara deliciosos potajes para los pobladores y los turistas que visitan este bello y tradicional poblado, la socia en esta oportunidad desea invertir el crédito en la compra de insumos tales como arroz, al por mayor en saco, azúcar para los tés que sirve y los cafés, aceite en bidón grande para las frituras, papa al por mayor y otros productos que requiere. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus diversos potajes.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Guillermina belongs to the "Las Emprendedoras de Andahuaylillas" communal bank, located in the Andahuaylillas district, in Cusco province and department.  

She is 56, and lives with her partner. She has three children, ages 31, 28, and 26. She has a restaurant that she runs and serves her customers in. She prepares delicious dishes for local people, and the tourists that visit this beautiful traditional village.  

On this occasion she wishes to use the loan to buy ingredients; such as bags of rice at wholesale, sugar for the teas and coffees she serves, a large barrel of cooking oil for frying, potatoes at wholesale, and other products she needs. She is applying for the loan to buy supplies and ingredients for preparing her various dishes. 

Guillermina is grateful for the loan, and promises to pay her instalments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for preparing her various dishes.

loans.name: Hope W.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Hope Women's Group in Western Kenya! Beatrice is the facilitator of the Hope Women's Group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now re-enrolling for a 3rd planting season.

Beatrice takes care of two children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 25 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Beatrice will invest in key assets such as livestock and pay for major expenses such as school fees.

In 2012, the members of Hope Women's Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old, married and has two children. She has six years of experience operating a tailoring business. She has employed one person to assist her in her tasks. She also relies on her husband for financial support.

Grace is thankful to Faulu Kenya for training her in financial management. She has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Tumurochir

texts.en: Tumurochir is 27 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She operates a jewely store with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2010 by renting a counter in a market. She's the only one who sells accessories in the market; therefore, it is very profitable. Her products are very limited due to her counter space, so she rented one more counter in the market. She has limited resources to run a whole counter, so she is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy more supplies.

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale

loans.name: Ziyodakhon

texts.ru: Зиёдахон жительница района Рудаки. Ей 24 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж имеет свою мастерскую, где занимается ремонтом легковых автомашин. Сама Зиёдахон у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей, чтобы сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Ziyodakhon is a resident of Rudaki region. She is 24 years old, married and has two children. Her husband runs a car repair shop and Ziyodakhon sews traditional Tajik dresses from home. She has been working as a seamstress for the last five years.  Ziyodakhon is taking out this loan to purchase more fabrics for sewing dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica, es comerciante de ropa, vive con su esposo  y sus dos hijos, el negocio de ella es la venta de ropa de niño, de damas, siendo vestidos, camisas, trajes, su forma de vender es de manera ambulante.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como blusas, pantalones, trajes para niños, ropa interior, para surtir el negocio, esto le ayudara para ofrecer a los clientes mejores estilos en prendas de vestir.
Su aspiración es ofrecer variedad a los clientes, ya que de esta manera le dará un buen sostenimiento al negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica is a clothing merchant who lives with her husband and two children.  She works as a street vendor selling children's and women's clothes such as dresses, shirts, and suits.

She is requesting a loan to buy blouses, trousers, underwear and children's suits to stock her business.  This will allow her to offer her customers better clothing styles.

Her goal is to offer a wide variety of merchandise to customers so she can keep her business going well.

loans.use: To buy blouses, trousers, and suits for children.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, a mother of three children, all of whom are enrolled in local school, is married to a factory worker who earns a low income. She is a very good housewife, and her family is very happy with her efficiency and her supportive nature.

Nasreenhas is very skillful and makes thread from used clothes. Now requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah, she will buy used clothes in bulk quantity to make thread to sell to her clients for profit. She has been operating her business for many years and is confident that the loan will help her to earn more income.

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Nasreen.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for her thread-making business

loans.name: Lenny

texts.es: Lenny, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además  de ser amable y cordial. Es separada de su pareja. pero tiene un hijo que vive a lado de él así como de su madre y sus dos hermanos, siendo uno de ellos casado y con familia. Juntos habitan en casa de su madre. Las actividades que realiza Lenny es la venta comida como ceviches, para eso cuenta con un local en casa de su madre al que le pusieron el nombre de Cevicheria "La Calesita", negocio que viene funcionando desde hace 10 años, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes con el apoyo de su madre, su cuñada, y sus hermanos en sus momentos libres. Paralelo a  esto también se dedica a la venta de ropa de damas y caballeros por temporadas, teniendo como clientes a sus amistades a quienes atiende a base de pedidos de los más bonitos modelos y a la moda, realizando la venta de manera personal y desde hace 5 años. Le gusta ambas actividades ya que la mantiene ocupada y le generan un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos propios y la de su hijo al que quiere mucho. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, e incursionar en otro como montar una librería tambiñen en casa de su madre, pues tiene espacio libre para habilitarlo. Este será el préstamo número 12 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo para avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal ya que conoce a la mayoría y los considera ser personas amables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 2600 nuevos soles tiene planes de invertirlo en la compra de ropa para damas y caballeros, ya que tiene pedidos por entregar.
texts.en:
33-year-old Lenny is a hard-working and tenacious woman who is also kind and friendly.  She is separated from her partner but has a son who lives with her.  She also lives with her mother and her two siblings.  One of her siblings is married and has a family.  They live together in her mother's house.

Lenny's business is selling food such as 'ceviche' (traditional marinated fish dish).  She has premises in her mother's house which they called 'Cevicheria La Calesita'.  She has been running the business for 10 years and very kindly serves her customers with the support of her mother, her sister-in-law and her siblings when they have free time.  In parallel with this, she also sells seasonal men's and women's clothing.  Her customers are her friends, who she serves based on their orders for the most beautiful and fashionable clothes.  She makes her sales personally and has been doing this for five years.  Lenny enjoys both businesses as they keep her busy and make her income with which to cover her own expenses and those of her son who she loves very much.  She has plans to expand her business and start another.  She plans to set up a stationery store in her mother's house as well as they have the space they need for this.

This will be Lenny's 12th loan from MFP.  She feels grateful for the financial support that she receives which enables her to make progress in her business.  She also feels comfortable with her community bank as she knows most of the members and considers them to be friendly and supportive people.  Lenny will use the 2,600 soles she has requested to invest in buying men's and women's clothing as she has orders to fill.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a married woman with two children. Marlyn is 32 years old, residing at Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

She used her last loan to purchase pesticides for banana growing. Now, Marlyn is busy with her pigs business. She requested a new loan to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She hopes to expand her new business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is married woman with two children. She is a hawker in new clothes and keeps moving from market to market in Teso district.  With the loan of US$450 she intends to increase her stock to meet the demand of her growing clients base.  With the loan from PEMCI she plans to expand her services to other neighboring districts especially Bungoma and Busia districts. Regina is an active and progressive member of the local community and can be instrumental in bringing about some positive changes. Pemci uses such clients as role models and to mentor others wishing to start their own businesses.

loans.use: To add her stock

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn employs three helpers in her workshop. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation and understands the TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of US$750 to expand her business. Paying back the loan shouldn't be a problem since she knows book-keeping and manages the business well.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Reginata Nabwile

texts.en: Reginata is a mother of eight.  She is a cereal seller who specializes in selling maize.  She started her business in 1971 when she realized that there was an unmet demand for the product. Although she has not undertaken any training pertaining to the business she does, she has learnt from doing.  She gets her stock from farmers during harvest season when the product is abundant, and stores the excess to sell later when supply is low.  Through her business, she has acquired experience.  Five of her chidren have finished schooling while the rest are still in school.  With a loan from PEMCI, Reginata wishes to increase her cereal stock  to meet the mounting demands of her customers.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es:
Hola mi nombre es Martha Maria, mi actividad es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva y calzado, la que distribuyo de manera ambulante y por encargo en mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, tengo 3 hijos los que estan estudiando y tambien me colaboran en distribuir el producto en su tiempo libre, lo mas importante es que puedo distribuir el tiempo entre atender a mi familia y el negocio.

Hi, my name is Martha Maria and my business is in selling new clothes and shoes which I sell in the streets of my neighborhood. I have several years dedicated to this bype of business, which generates income for my family expenses and other obligations. I have three children that study and who also help me with the business in their spare time. The most important thing about my business is that it gives me the opportunity to be able to distribute time between looking after my family and the attending of the business.

loans.use: Compra de cortinas, toallas de baño,  zapatias de hombre, sandalias de mujer, blusa de dama// Purchase of curtains, bath towels, men's shoes, women's sandals, women's blouses

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman is a low income person from the Beylagan District, Azerbaijan. He is married, 51 years old, and has 2 children. He sells various goods in the market. He has been in this business for 6 years. He applied for $800 from Normicro to buy more inventory and increase his business volume.

loans.use: To Increase Inventory

loans.name: Ni Nengah Witoni

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Witoni's daily routine start at 5am, where she goes to the market to source for fresh goods such as vegetables. She operate a stall which sells a variety of household daily needs, which in turn finances her daily needs. Besides that, Ni Nengah Witoni also sells gado-gado (local delicacy). Her stalls start at 9am in the morning till 6 in the evening. Everyday she earns about Rp.15.000. This lessen the burden of her family. With the financial assistance from Dinari, she intends to have a permanent stall and also increase the variety of items that is being sold. During peak time, her husband also helps her out in her stall. The live in a modest home with 3 children. The financial assistance has benefited her, she has already felt the increase in her sales.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Bangun pukul 05.00 wita pagi dan pergi kepasar, untuk mencari bahan berjualan sudah menjadi kegiatan yang rutin bagi Ni Nengah Witoni. Karena bila masih pagi semua bahan yang diperlukan masih tersedia dan segar, seperti sayur - sayuran dan barang – barang kebutuhan pokok lainnya. Dengan membuka warung dan menjual barang kebutuhan sehari – hari, sangat membantu untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Selain menjual kebutuhan sehari – hari, Ni Nengah Witoni juga menjual gado – gado ( makanan tradisional yang terbuat dari beras yang dibungkus daun, lalu direbus. Setelah matang, beras akan mengeras dan kemudian dipotong – potong lalu dicampur dengan bumbu dan sayuran ). Warung Ni Nengah Witoni buka pukul 09.00 wita sampai dengan pukul 18.00 wita. Dari usaha ini Ni Nengah Witoni menerima keuntungan setiap hari Rp.15.000 bersih. Keuntungan ini sangat berguna dan sangat dirasakan karena bisa meringankan sedikit beban rumah tangganya. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, ia rencanakan untuk menambah barang dagangan dan membuat lokasi warung yang lebih permanen, karena yang sekarang masih memanfaatkan halaman depan rumahnya untuk berjualan. Semakin hari usaha warung Ni Nengah Witoni semakin ramai. Kadang Nyoman Sukama, suami dari Ni Nengah Witoni, juga membantu bila warungnya ramai pembeli. Mereka tinggal dirumah yang sederhana dengan 3 orang anak. Pinjaman yang didapatnya dirasakan sangat membantu karena akan dapat meningkatkan usahanya

loans.use: Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli aneka barang dagangan kebutuhan sehari - hari - Increased capital to purchase more variety of items.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani is a 39-year-old mother with an 18-year-old child. She makes a living selling vegetables, and usually earns about $3 per day. Her husband, S., also sells vegetables by going around the village door-to-door and earns $8 per day. Ani has come to us for a loan of $75 to expand her business by buying more vegetables to sell, and will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Hakimali

texts.ru:
Hakimali F. is 44 years old, has completed high school, is married and has 5 children. Hakimali sells milk as well as makes and sells soured milk products (yoghurt, buttermilk, cheese). He purchases the milk from the local farmers. Mr. F. is planning to use the loan to purchase a larger volume of milk in order to offer more milk and milk products to the local families of Khuroson. He is planning to pay back the loan in the next 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Файзуллоев Хакимали, возраст – 44 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 5-х детей. Хакимали занимается продажей молока, а также производством кисло-молочной продукции и дальнейшей её реализации местным жителям. Молоко он пиобретает у местных фермеров. Полученный кредит поможет ему приобретать больше молока, что даст ему возможность производить больше продукции и обеспечивать местных жителей молоком и другими молочными продуктами. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of milk and soured milk products

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve B. is 38 years old and married with one child. She has been an LAPO member for 8 years, and has been in business for the same length of time. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to enable her buy more provisions and cosmetics for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Camp Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hellen T.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Hellen is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a watchman. She has 2 children who go to school. Each week, Hellen makes approximately 300 Sudanese pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest in her business and pay the school fees of her children.

Hellen is joined in her small group by Lucia M., Ludia S., Dorsela K., and Roda D.. Lucia M. has a business selling breads and wants to expand the business. Ludia S. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to expand the business. Dorsela K. operates a business selling beer and wants to expand the business. Roda D. is currently in the business of selling breads and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Fatma's Wapendanao Group

texts.en:
Fatma is 47 years old and is a married woman with no children. She and her husband take care of 5 other people, varying in age between 50-80 years old. Fatma conduct small business, starting in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Khadija.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a mother with two children. She is fifty six years old and she sells cloth and assorted meat in her village. She buys her products from Kumasi and Accra and retails the items in the Western Region of Ghana.

Grace wants to use her loan to buy more assorted meat and cloth to increase her inventory and also to avoid price hikes. She a member of the group called Animonyam (meaning "Glory"). Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and assorted meat

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi T., 37 years old, is a very special case. Her husband passed away and she does not have any children. She is currently living with her old mother. Therefore, she is responsible for all the housework. She always tries her best to better her living situation. She joined the TYM Fund to borrow money and invest in breeding animals. Over the time, she diligently took care of her project and earned lots of breeding experience. She used both her saving money and borrowed money to expand her breeding plan. She was successful and her family economy experienced improvement. This time she wants to borrow 375 USD. Her average income is approximately 100 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dào Thị Tươi 37 tuổi, có hoàn cảnh gia đình đặc biệt không giống các chị em khác, chồng mất sớm bản thân chị lại chưa có con, hiện tai chị đang sống cùng mẹ già, mọi công việc trong gia đình đều chút lên đôi vai chị, biết được số phận của mình như vây chị luôn có ý thức vươn lên. Chị tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, tần tảo chịu thương chịu khó chăm sóc dự án của mình chị cũng đã thành công trong việc chăn nuôi, dần dần chị đã tích lũy được kinh nghiệm trong chăn nuôi, và đã có chút vốn tiết kiệm kết hợp với việc vay vốn của Quỹ, chị mạnh giạn mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi, với mô hình chăn nuôi đó chị đều thành công và kinh tế gia đình đã thay đổi, từ lúc khó khăn nay đã gia đình đã khá hơn rất nhiều. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.Thu nhập bình quân 1.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally T., 45, and her husband, Mr. Bin Bou, 52, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1987 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Their oldest daughter is in the makeup business and also weaves with her parents, while the other three children are in local school.

Mrs. Phally and her husband have been silk weavers and in the makeup business for over 20 years. Phally sells her silk products to the middleman in the village, who then resells them in Phnom Penh. Her makeup business is in demand for wedding ceremonies in the village and nearby communities. Now she is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase silk material for her family’s weaving business and to build a handrail for her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and build a handrail for her house.

loans.name: Ama Elise

texts.fr:
Madame Ama Elise A. is from the village of Gbatopé, where she was born on August 2, 1975. She is married and the mother of two children. Her occupation is the sale of charcoal and staple products in the Tokoin Forever neighborhood of Lomé. This has been her job since 2006, and she always helps her husband with the family’s expenses. She has received a loan from WAGES once before, and paid it back promptly. This, her second loan, will allow her to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal, ten sacks of rice and two drums of vegetable oil. With this new stock, she will be able to make more sales and earn considerable income.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Ama Elise est originaire de gbatopé village dans lequel elle est née le 2 août 1975. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a pour activité la vente du charbon de bois et des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier de Tokoin Forever à Lomé. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2006 et aide toujours son mari dans les dépenses de la famille. Elle a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. Ce second crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 10 sacs de charbons de bois, 10 sacs de riz et 2 bidons d’huile végétale. Ainsi avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra bien vendre et tirer beaucoup de revenu.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Gaméli

texts.fr: Gaméli K. est un artisan cordonnier âgé de 35 ans, mariée et père de 2 enfants.  Pour gagner de l’argent, il fabrique et revend des chaussures en plus des réparations. Avec ce deuxième crédit et grâce à la chance de Kiva, il désire acheter des matières premières et s’équiper en outils de fabrication afin de relever les défis de la technologie et faire face au besoin de sa clientèle. Avec cette opportunité, monsieur Gaméli espère bien gagner sa vie et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gaméli K., 35, is a shoemaker. He is married and the father of two children. To earn money, he makes and sells shoes as well as doing repairs. With this, his second loan, and thanks to the chance offered by Kiva, he would like to purchase raw materials and outfit himself with tools for shoe-making, so as to make better use of technology and be responsive to the needs of his clientele. With this opportunity, Gaméli hopes to earn a good living and care for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing raw materials and outfitting himself with tools for shoe-making

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for a small business.

loans.name: Muvo Women's Group

texts.en: K. Naome is the leader of Muvo women’s group in Lugazi. Along with taking care of, and paying school fees for her five children, she also looks after two of her relatives' children. Naome has a retail shop which she has maintained and expanded with the assistance of her first loan. She is requesting another loan so she can buy more products like bread, toothpaste, cooking oil and other products for her shop. By joining this lending group, she hopes that she can get a loan to help improve her business and the life of her family.

loans.use: To buy products for retail shop

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is 43 years old and married with three children.

Lidia is a member of the Dos Mil ("two thousand") Village Bank, and she has now been approved for an individual loan, a new product being offered by FINCA Peru for the holiday season to some of its oldest, most responsible clients. She is requesting 2000 soles to buy potatoes from local farms, which she then brings to markets in Ayacucho to sell to vendors.

Lidia has been a FINCA client for four years now, and now has her own investment capital. She and her husband now own two cars, which they rent out to drivers to use as taxis. Still, Lidia plans to continue working with FINCA for the foreseeable future.

loans.use: Buy potatoes from local farmers

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem R., 53, is rice farmer who lives in Botrumdoul Village in the Pursat province. She has been farming with her husband since 1979. They both work hard everyday with the farm, supporting the family's expenses. She has ten children, seven of whom are married and have left home, living independently. Three are single, and live in the family's home, helping with the farm. As another source of income, Mrs. R. operates a tailoring business that she learned when younger, but now, just sews for family's members. Because she lacks sufficient money to run the business, she would like to request a loan to purchase cloth and make a small shop to provide the tailoring service.

loans.use: Purchase cloth and make a small shop to provide tailoring service

loans.name: Courage Group

texts.en:
This is Kadiatu K., Abdul K., Fatmata K., Koloneh S., and Mohamed S.. They named their group Courage. These entrepreneurs have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. The previous loans have had meaningful impacts in the lives of these people. The last loan they received from Kiva through SMT was for Le 800,000.00 each. Now, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000.00 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses.

Kadiatu K. (left) is the leader of this group. Kadiatu is 30 years of age. She was born in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a local court chairman. The 2 of them have 2 children. One of their children is in Junior Secondary School II (JSS II) and the other is in class VI. She has been in business for 6 years now. Kadiatu sells firewood, plastics, water, and gara lappers (locally dyed clothes).

With this loan of Le 1,000,000.00, Kadiatu will use it to buy one truck load of firewood and 3 “pieces” (a piece is about 30 yards of white cotton used in making the gara lappers). A truck load of firewood costs Le 500,000 in a village called Madit, about 5 miles from Makeni. A piece of “brillian” (the white cotton is called brillian) costs Le 80,000. She will use some of the remaining sum to buy inks, powder, and soda and pay workers who designed the clothes with different styles.

So far, Kadiatu faces no major challenges in her business. Business is going fine for her, and she enjoys doing it.

With the profit she makes, Kadiatu uses part of it to repay her loan, pay her children’s school fees, and do things that make her life happy.

loans.use: To buy a truck load of firewood and 3 pieces of "brillians"

loans.name: Mrs. Lam Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people living in Toek Hout village in Kampong Chhnang province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Lam C., the 61-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. In this plantation, she faces two problems because her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to buy fuel to support a pump for watering the field. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Lam C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and fuel. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living situation. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is a farmer helping on the mother's plantation.

All the members in this loan group are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Sr. De Torrechayoc – Mototaxistas. Group

texts.es:
Este banco es denominado “SR. DE TORRECHAYOC”; lleva el nombre del santo patrón de la provincia de Urubamba, y este banco lo conforman 11 miembros, todos ellos viven en la provincia de Urubamba, todos son casados y tienen hijos menores.

Estos nuevos socios son dueños de sus propios vehículos de modalidad - mototaxis, estos prestan servicio público en la provincia de Urubamba y es muy común puesto a que Urubamba es pequeña y de calle afirmadas y angostas, ellos adecuaron sus motos con una especie de carrocería y de este modo, pasó hacer un medio de transporte rápido y económico; nuestros socios quieren invertir el préstamo otorgado en el mantenimiento de sus mototaxis, mejorar la apariencia y de está manera dar un mejor servicio y mayor vida sus herramientas de trabajo, en el caso de las socias mujeres  una de ellas lo alquila a una tercera persona.

Estos socios están muy agradecidos y realmente valoran el apoyo otorgado por este medio y ellos se comprometen a cumplir con los pagos en las fechas establecidas.
texts.en:
This bank is named after the town's patron saint, "SR. DE TORRECHAYOC". This bank is located in the state of Urubamba and is composed of 11 members. They all live in Urubamba. They are all married and they all have young children. These new members all have their own individual business which is driving 'mototaxis.' This type of transportation in Urubamba is very common since the streets are very narrow and tight. This type of transportation is very fast and economical. Our members would like to invest this loan in the maintenance of their 'mototaxis' so that they can provide a better service to their clients and make sure their 'mototaxis' will last as long as possible since they represent their work tools. In the case of the women who are members, one of them is renting her 'mototaxi' to a third person. These members are all very thankful and they trully appreciate all the support given to them. They have all agreed on making the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mototaxi maintenance

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
В декабре у Бахтиера закончились погашения займа полученного им год назад. В бизнесе Бахтиера полученный займ внес весомый вклад - сейчас он выпекает больше лепешек чем прежде. Для дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса Бахтиер подал новую  заявку на займ. Он планирует закупить оптом муку и уголь.
P.S. на фото жена Бахтиера
texts.en:
Last December, Bahtiyor finished repaying the loan he received a year ago. This loan brought a measurable gain to Bahtiyor’s business because now he bakes more flat bread than before. Bahtiyor would like to obtain a new loan in order to further expand his business. He plans to use this loan to buy flour and coal wholesale. P.S. The photo shows Bahtiyor’s wife.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of flour and coal

loans.name: Therson

texts.en: Therson C. B. is 39 years old, he is married with four children who are all currently in school. Therson is a Hardware dealer and he sells paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammer, PVC pipes and other goods in Twifo Praos, the town where he has lived with his family for nine years. He buys his supplies from importers in the greater Accra of Ghana at wholesale prices and then sells to his customers at retail prices. Therson will use the loan to increase his stock of paints, nails, hammers, and other goods, and to accelerate the growth of his business. With the loan, he hopes to increase savings, to expand his shop, and to start selling cement. He belongs to the village bank called ‘Joyful way’, and he is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of assorted paints, nails, sand paper, hammers etc and to begin selling cement

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
“God provides everything for you immediately, when you ask for help”. This is the guiding principle of Marilyn C., a village store owner in Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela.  She is married to Donato. They have a son named Michael, 29 years old, who works as a tricycle driver in their village. 

The couple is doing their best to benefit their family. She has been operating her store for almost eight months and it serves as their daily source of income. She wants to improve her store and has asked for a loan of PHP 10, 000 ( USD 225 ) to buy additional grocery items and hopefully for her business to become profitable.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for store.

loans.name: Ojiugo

texts.en: Ojiugo is a mother of 6 children; she is 38 years old and married. She sells provisions and medicines. Ojiugo hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions and medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: 14-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Xuân Hắc Thị (84) is a 65-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Xuân is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 14-Nam Ngạn (17-07-14).

Xuân is married and has 3 adult children. To making a living, Xuân owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Xuân has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,200,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $67) a month from these activities.

In 2007, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Xuân has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,442,900 dong from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 dong which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. The loan will be the 4th loan she has taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuân plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. N. Thị Hội (83) is a 60-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. P. Thị Hà (88) is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3. Lê Thị Hảo (114) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. N. Thị Lan (116) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 dong loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Xuân Hắc Thị (84) là 65 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Xuân là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 14-Nam Ngạn (17-07-14).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Xuân thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Xuân kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND. Vào 2007, Xuân đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Xuân đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.442.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. N. Thị Hội (83) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. P. Thị Hà (88) là 42 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

3. Lê Thị Hảo (114) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. N. Thị Lan (116) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

*Note: Many FPW borrowers have expressed a desire to borrow larger amounts to make more significant investments in their businesses. In response to this, FPW has recently added a new loan product of 6,000,000 dong with a 20 month term to its Thanh Hoa City branch portfolio.

loans.use: For baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Nabyonga Edith Group

texts.en:
Edith is the leader of a five member group. She is a 35 year old, married with six children; ages four to 22. Three of her children go to school.

She owns a one room house where she stays with eight people. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. Her family gets two meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Edith sells bananas in the Makerere Kikoni Market, one of Kampala suburbs. She sells to an average of seven people a day and works six days a week. Edith buys bananas from the Nakasero Market, one of the busiest in Kampala. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family.

She has been in this business for the last twenty years. Edith has been with MCDT for over eight months and is servicing her second loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas. Edith hopes her business will grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise. .

loans.use: Buy bananas to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona N. hails from the coastal town of Cardona, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 36 years old and is determined and hopeful to bring her family out of poverty. She is married to Diosdado who is 43 years old. She is a strong mother to six children, all underage and still dependent on her.

Her husband is a construction worker. His income is not fixed and insufficient for their needs because he is not always able to find work. This led Chona to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2008. She makes doormats out of used clothes. She tried to develop it as a business and it went well.

Now on her third loan, she is asking for 15,000 pesos as additional capital to purchase assorted clothes as raw material, scissors, flannel board and other materials needed for doormat making. She is confident that her business will bring them a good income since they have regular customers and they even receive orders.

She hopes to expand her business and to be able to save for her children’s future needs, especially school fees.

loans.use: To pay assorted clothes as raw material, scissors, flannel board and other needed materials for doormat making.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells baby items and wears. She has been in the business for the past 7 years. Fumilayo has been borrowing from lapo for the past 1 year and she lives in Badagry. She is 35 years old and married with 5 children. Fumilayo is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more baby items to sell. She thanks all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items to sell

loans.name: Danyo

texts.fr: Cette dame habite de quartier d’Adamavo à Lomé où elle vend du charbon de bois. Elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce depuis 1989. Le mari de cette femme est maçon et le couple a 04 enfants à sa charge. C’est parce que les revenus du mari n’arrivent plus à couvrir tous les besoins du foyer qu’elle a décidé de vendre du charbon de bois. Aujourd’hui sa longue expérience du domaine fait qu’elle dispose d’un nombre élevé de clients. Pour acheter 70 sacs de charbon de bois, elle sollicite alors un crédit de WAGES. Elle compte sur sa meilleure connaissance du secteur pour vite rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Adamavo neighborhood of Lomé where she sells charcoal. She launched this business in 1989. This woman's husband is a mason and the couple have 4 children in their care. It is because her husband's income no longer manages to cover all of the household needs that she has decided to sell charcoal. Today her lengthy experience in the field has given her a large number of customers. In order to purchase 70 sacks of charcoal she is requesting a loan from WAGES. She is counting on her excellent knowledge of the sector to quickly repay the loan.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ma Margarita

texts.es: Ma Margarita M. es una señora que ya va por el tercer crédito los anteriores los utilizo para su negocio es por ello que esta agradecida por esto ya que se ha ido superando poco a poco. La señora Margarita tiene un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Miscelánea M.” el cual ya tiene 3 años vendiendo de todo como dulces, botana, refrescos, lácteos y abarrotes. Ella trabaja en la maquiladora y su esposo por las mañana le ayuda en el negocio para no cerrarlo durante el día, y ella no quiere dejar de trabajar para tener atención medica.
texts.en:
Ma Margarita M. is currently on her third loan cycle. She used her previous loans for her business, which is why she is grateful that she has been getting ahead little by little. Ms. Margarita M. has a general store called “Miscelánea M.,” which has been in business for 3 years. She sells candy, snacks, beverages, dairy products, and provisions. In the morning, she works at an assembly plant, so her husband minds the store so that they do not have to close during the day. She does not want to stop working because she wants to have health care.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her shop

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie M. is from the village of Mohon. She is 40 years old. Elvie is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elvie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Osahon

texts.en: Osahon is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She sells various kinds of shoes. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia A. is married and has three children. She has no educational background. Cecelia sells smoked fish at Elmina near Aish, which she has been doing since 2002. Her husband is a fisherman. Cecelia uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Cecelia will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecelia plans to save towards building her own house and to reinvest.

loans.use: Cecelia will use the loan to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Juan Elias

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Elias G. se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros, tiene un taxi de su propiedad.
su taxi esta funcionando bien, pero necesita hacerle cambio de llantas y de algunos repuestos y mantenimiento al motor, cambio de aceite, filtros, empaques y otros.
el desea mejorar su unidad para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Juan Elias tiene clientes fijos que lleva todos los dias en las mañanas para los trabajos y en las tardes para sus casas, durante el dia anda buscando clientes por toda la ciudad de danli y ahi hace muchas carreras.
Juan Elias se siente muy feliz ya que su carro le esta generando dinero y tiene pensado comprar mas carros para ponerlos de taxi.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos y desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Elias G. owns a taxi (passenger service) business. His cab is working well, but needs to change its tires and some parts in order to do tune up his engine (oil change, filters, gaskets, etc.) Making these repairs will help him provide better service to his customers. Juan Elias has regular customers who use his services daily in the mornings for work transportation and in the afternoons to return home. And, during the hours in between, he drives all over the city of Danli and takes in many other customers. Juan Elias is very happy because his car is generating income, and he hopes to purchase additional cars to use in his taxi service. This is his only source of income and he wishes to improve the quality of his family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de repuestos de automovil (to purchase automobile parts)

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza R., 25 years old, hails from a farming family in Balubad, Silang, Cavite. She is married to Regie, 24, a factory worker. Riza grows pineapples in a family-owned farm lot. Since farming is a seasonal source of income, Riza also sells dried fish to her neighbors. She earns close to PHP 3,000 a month.  
 
Riza is now on her sixth loan cycle with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She enjoys the camaraderie of the women entrepreneurs. She is applying for a new loan in the amount of PHP 9,000, which she will use to fund the next pineapple crop season. She will purchase fertilizers and pesticides.  

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mrs. Ra B. is a villager in Sdao Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Svay Duong, is a construction worker. He is also a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile and he does not have rice seed for growing. Thus, Mrs. Ra B. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizers and to pay for plowing the field. She is 33 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to study. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizers and to pay for plowing the field.

loans.name: Byambahishig

texts.en:
Byambahishig is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two teenage children in a house in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her son and daughter, aged 18 and 14, both attend a local high school while her husband helps Byambahishig with the family business.

Byambahishig operates a grocery retail business out of two rented stalls at a local market. She sells a variety of vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, cabbages, onions, garlic, etc. She started her business in 1996 with working capital of 300,000 tugrugs (~210 USD). Since then she has managed her business successfully and established a strong customer base.

With her business earnings Byambahishig was able to buy some land and build a house in 2009 in order to improve her family's quality of life. Moreover, she bought a car for her family use. Now her working capital exceeds 4,000,000 tugrugs (~2800 USD).

Byambahishig is an intelligent businesswoman with a good personality. She says, "I want to improve my business and open my own grocery shop in the future." Byambahishig is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase a wide variety of vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of vegetables

loans.name: Homero Gabriel

texts.es:
Homero Gabriel G. Q. tiene 30 años de edad y vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  Es separado y tiene una hija de 3 meses que se llama Emily Gabriela.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Se dedica a la agricultura toda vida como principal fuente económica de su familia.  Dentro de las cosechas que sobresalen son maíz, papas, trigo.  Vende sus cultivos en la feria del cantón San Miguel los días jueves.  Solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, semillas, y mano de obra.  Su sueño para el futuro es construir una casa propia para sus hijos.  El desafío principal que enfrenta G. es mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia que tenga un estudio de sus hijos.
Lo que le gusta de su comunidad es que es muy tranquila, unida, y responsable.  A todos los miembros de la familia les gusta trabajar en el campo.  Son atentos y buenos jugadores de voleibol.
texts.en:
Homero Gabriel G. Q. is 30 years old and lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar Province. He is separated from his wife and has a 3 month old daughter named Emily Gabriela. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. He has worked in agriculture his whole life and this is the primary income for his family. The crops he plants most are corn, potatoes, and wheat. He sells his crops in the San Miguel canton market on Thursdays. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs, seed, and labor. His dream for the future is to build his own house for his children. The greatest difficulties G. confronts are improving his family’s quality of life and making sure his children have an education. What he likes about his community is that it is very quiet, close-knit, and responsible. All the members of his family enjoy working in the fields. They are attentive and good volleyball players.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs, seed, and labor

loans.name: Juana Silvia

texts.es: Juana Silvia V. D. F. D. 33 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Armenia, ubicado en el departamento D. Sonsonate. Vive en compañía D. su esposo y su hijo D. 9 años D. edad. Juana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, la que esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación desD. hace mas D. 2 años. Es por medio D. este negocio como Juana junto a su familia, han logrado seguir adelante, ya que es este la única fuente D. ingresos que posee, es por ello que es D. mucha importancia poder surtir la tienda con productos los cuales sean muy solicitado en el lugar y así mismo agregar otros nuevos. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para aumentar su inventario, D. esta manera ella podrá contar con mayor cantidad D. clientes y así mismo vender más productos lo cual le generen mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana Silvia V. D. F. is 33 years old and a resident of the town of Armenia, located in the Department of Sonsonate. She lives with her husband and her nine year old son. For more than two years, she has managed a store in her home where she sells basic necessities. Through this business, Juana and her family have been able to get ahead because this is their only source of income. Therefore, it is very important to keep the store stocked with the products that are most requested as well as add new items. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she will have the money to increase her inventory. As a result, she will have more customers, sell more products, and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Cecilia Alexandra

texts.es:
Cecilia Z. de 45 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposo trabaja como chofer en una camaronera con el tiene 3 hijos.

Empezó hace 13 años solo vendiendo cuadernos. Cuando a su esposo lo liquidaron de la empresa donde trabajaba empezó en su casa de caña vendiendo cuadernos y plumas.  

Ahora ella tiene una casa de cemento y trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días. Vende cuadernos, bisutería, regalos, cartulinas etc. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es la delincuencia en el sector. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y bebidas para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener otra papelería.
texts.en:
Cecilia Z. is 45 years old and lives in a suburb of Guayquil. Her house is made of cement and has only lights and water for basic services. Her husband works as a driver for a shrimp producer, and together they have three children. 13 years ago Cecilia started just selling notebooks. When her husband was let go by his employer she started selling notebooks and pens from her house that was made from bamboo. She now owns a concrete house and works from 6 am to 10 pm every day. She sells notebooks, jewelry, gifts, postcards, etc. One of the challenges she faces is the crime in her neighborhood. Cecilia wants to purchase notebooks, pens, and soft drinks for her customers with the loan. In the future, she hopes to open another stationary shop.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, pens and drinks

loans.name: Nilder

texts.es:
Nilder tiene 22 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nelcy de 22 años y su querido hijo Cristian de 5 años, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

En el poblado de “San Juan de la Libertad” se encuentran las chacras de Nilder. Desde muy joven aprendió la agricultura de sus padres y ahora el tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales con ayuda de su esposa cultiva y trabaja diariamente. Sus productos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad y debido a la buena calidad de éstos siempre recibe un muy buen pago.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas; lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado mayorista. 
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para tener su propio puesto de venta, en el cual pueda trabajar su esposa, ya que actualmente vende sus productos de forma ambulante.

Este es el primer préstamo de Nilder con MFP y siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgulloso. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja para incrementar la producción de este producto, ya que está teniendo gran demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Nilder, age 22, is a very happy and hard-working young man. He lives in his own house with his 22 year old wife, Nelcy, and their beloved five year old son, Cristian. They are the primary motive for all of his efforts. Nilder’s fields are in the San Juan de la Libertad village. He learned about farming from his parents when he was very young. Now he has his own land. With help from his wife, he cultivates and works on the land everyday. He takes his products to sell at the wholesale market in the city. He is always paid very well because of the good quality of his crops. What he likes best about his work is taking care of his crops so that they are not affected by pests. He has been doing this activity for six years. The most difficult part is transporting his crops to the wholesale market. For the future of his business he hopes to get together enough money to have his own sales stand. He could work there with his wife. She currently sells their products as a traveling vendor. This is Nilder’s first loan with MFP. He feels that this loan will help him a lot to develop his business. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank, and he is very proud of that. He will use the 1,000 PEN that he has requested to buy pea seeds to increase his production of this product. There is currently a great demand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds

loans.name: Martín Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Martín R. es trabajador en el Centro Escolar Salesiano, en el que se desempeña como vigilante, con el salario que el tiene se logra mantener así como también a su nieta la que está en edad escolar y el prácticamente le provee para los gastos del colegio, el crédito que solicita a  CEPRODEL lo quiere para uso personal, ya que piensa hacer varias compras para él y su nieta.
texts.en:
Martín works as a security guard in the “Centro Escolar Salesiano” (Salesiano School Center). His salary allows him to support himself and his granddaughter. She is school aged and he pays for her education. He is requesting this loan through CEPRODEL for personal use. He needs to buy some things for his granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is part of the “Unidos para el Triunfo” community bank, which translates to “United for Triumph”. She is 40-years-old and lives in Cuzco with her spouse and their three children, ages fifteen, four, and two. Her oldest child studies in a local high school, and her youngest will soon be entering kindergarten. Marisol supports her family by selling ceviche, a common lunch dish made from raw fish and onions that have been “cooked” in lime juice. She says her business is currently going well, but that she would like to further increase her revenues from it.

Marisol will use her Kiva loan to improve this small business. She is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy ceviche ingredients

loans.name: Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es:
La Alcancia Comunal Shalom Dios con nosotros, es una de las más antiguas de la agencia, Delfina es una buena artesana hace 6 años elabora tejidos como bolsos, carteras chalinas, ponchos, de acuerdo a la estación y solicitud de sus clientes, los materiales que usa son variados como lana, y diversos tipos de hilos. Tiene 4 hijos de los cuales se hace responsable de 2, de ellos con el préstamo obtenido lo invertirá en la compra de productos para mejorar sus tejidos..
Enriqueta se dedica a la venta de tortas y diferentes tipos de postres en un local que con mucho esfuerzo pudo alquilar, aunque tiene mucha competencia trata de mejorar sus productos para obtener más ganancias, Enriqueta desea aumentar su negocio así que con el préstamo  invertirá en la compra de una batidora y otros utensilios que necesita.
La enfermera del grupo es Ruth, ella vende productos Unión como son: pan de molde, queques, pyes, galletas, y otros. Esto le permite pagar sus estudios de enfermería que lo está terminando  Todo el grupo agradece el préstamo y se comprometen en cancelar sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
The savings group "Shalom Dios Con Nosotros" is one of the oldest working with this microfinance agency. Delfina is a fine artesan who, for six years, has been weaving items such as bags, purses, shawls, and ponchos. The items vary according to the season and the requests of her clients. She uses various materials such as wool and different types of thread. She has four children, of whom she is still responsible for two. She will use the loan to buy prodcuts to improve her weaving. Enriqueta sells cakes and different types of desserts from a location that she was able to rent thanks to much effort on her part. Although she is very skilled, she is working to improve her products in order to gain more income. Enriqueta wishes to grow her business and so she will use the loan to buy a blender and other tools that she needs. Ruth is the nurse of the group. She sells products made by Unión, such as bread, cakes, pies, cookies, and more. This pays for her nursing studys, and she is currently finishing her courses. The whole group is grateful for the loan and they promise to complete their repayments according to the agreed timeline. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Munawar Sultana's Group

texts.en:
Munawar Sultana is a wife of M. R. and they both are citizens of the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. They own a small, two-roomed house where they have lived with their family for over 35 years.
Munawar is an efficient lady in her work. She manages perfectly her domestic chores as well as her business sewing clothes. She sews clothes for her neighbors with her machine, which she purchased last year with the profits of her business. Her husband operates a grocery shop in the community. He selected this work because he has three years of selling experience in a general store as a salesman.
Munawar is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to invest the capital into her husband’s grocery shop so he can purchase groceries in bulk and increase his profit.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita T. is from the village of Malalinta. She is 58 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Estrelita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Estrelita has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Estrelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Bano's Group

texts.en:
Bano is the wife of M. Z. and lives in Multan, the city of sweetmeats and holy places in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over ten years.  

Bano is a caring lady.  She is a very good mother who takes care of her children and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. 

Her husband has a mobile phone shop in the market. He sells new and used handsets. His customer service is very good. Other shop keepers come to him to seek guidance in handsets because he has been doing this work for the last eight years.  

Bano has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) for her husband's mobile phone shop. With the loan, he will increase his mobile phone variety which will attract more customers to his shop and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones to sell.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang C. is 34 years old and the village bank president. She was selected by the 16 members who are located in Pongro village in Takeo province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose and they hope to increase their income to improve their family's living conditions.
 
Mrs. Neang C. is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she is also a pig breeder at home. She earns a small income to support her family. In order to support the farm, Mrs. Neang C. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer and to pay a laborer to plow her farm. Mrs. Neang C. is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. Mrs. Thei Chim is the group guarantor and she is also present in the picture.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer and to pay a laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey K. was born in 1960 who is a group leader has been selected by six members whom all are made up a group loan located in Roka village in Takeo province. All members will use portion of their loan for varied ways in which it can improve their businesses.
