Mrs. Srey K. is a vegetable seller at her local market where she can earn some money to support her family. Since her face business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve this goal, Mrs. Srey K. is requesting for a loan to purchase more vegetable, duck ages, dry fishes to resale. Her husband, Mr. Leav Tes, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he is able to grow rice to sell to support his family. This couple supports two children, one of whom is a motorbike repair, while the other is studying at school.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable, duck ages, dry fishes to resale

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe Esmeralda

texts.es: La Señora Ana Guadalupe es una mujer muy trabajadora, que le gusta siempre ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja como profesor en una escuela primaria y ella vende nieve y comida rápida. Ella requiere de este crédito para invertir al negocio, y así obtener mayores ganancias y poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija pequeña.
texts.en:
Ana Guadalupe is a hard-working woman who always likes to help her husband with the household expenses. Her husband works as a teacher in an elementary school. She sells ice-cream and fast food. She needs this loan to invest in her business. That way she will get more income and be able to give her little daughter a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: God’S Children Group

texts.en:
Musu S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God’s Children. Musu is 56 years old, married, and has six children who range from 21 to 35 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling.

For 6 years, she has been selling charcoal in Gbengba Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal.

She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her dream is to grow her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Andrew is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael C. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. He is 42 years old. Ismael is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ismael operates a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor-transport services. Ismael has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 4,350 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ismael joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ismael is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Ismael from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Natig

texts.ru:
Natig K. 23 qoda. On ne jenat. Natig yavlyayetsya IDP personom on preselenec iz Fuzuli, Seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste s semyoy.

Natig uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznesom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo druqa kotoriy pomoq yemu otkrit etot magazin. Seychas Natig nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovari na zimniy sezon dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Natig K. is 23 years old. He is not married. Natig is an IDP (internally displaced person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli and now lives in the Absheron region together with his family. Natig has been involved in this business for 4 years. He learned this business from his friend, who helped him open this store. Now Natig needs 2000 AZN to buy merchandise for the winter season for resale and develop his own business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for resale

loans.name: Vicenta Emperatriz

texts.es:
Vicenta de 51 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada Duran de Guayaquil lugar caracterizado por su ecología en disolución. Tiene una tienda de víveres y venta de arroz. 

Empezó con la tienda cuando su esposo salio del trabajo y necesitaban dinero para mantener a sus hijos. Comenzaron a comprar arroz y vender por libra y así poco a poco vendieron por quintal. Después de tener capital pudo comprar suficiente dinero para surtir una tienda con víveres.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz para tener suficiente para sus clientes. En el futuro quiere comprar un vehiculo y ser distribuidor de arroz por todo Guayaquil y asi asegurar la economía de su casa.
texts.en:
Vicenta, 51 years of age, lives in the outskirts of Duran de Guayaquil known for it's community and natural resources. She owns a grocery store and sells rice.

Vicenta began her business when her husband lost his job and they needed money to support their children. She began by buying and selling rice per pound and then gradually she sold rice by the hundredweight (100 kilograms).  Then, after having enough capital, she bought enough to run a grocery store!  With this loan, she wants to buy enough rice to have enough for her customers. In the future, she wants to buy a car and become a distributor of rice around Guayaquil and in turn ensure her home's economy.

loans.use: Arroz (rice)

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: La familia D. L. es una familia muy trabajadora ya que tiene su taller D. costura establesido desD. hace 10 años y con el cual sacaron a sus hijos adelante y utilisara su credito para la compra D. maquinaria y amplearan su taller para mejorar su ingreso familiar.
texts.en: The D. L. family is very hard-working and has had a sewing workshop for the past 10 years. The business has allowed the family and their children to stay afloat. They will use the loan to buy machinery and expand the workshop so they can increase their family income.

loans.use: to buy sewing machinery

loans.name: Comfort Esi Akyere

texts.en:
Comfort Esi Akyere A. sells maize and cooks yams for sale at Abura. She has been through senior high school.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband to take care of the household. The loan will be added to her capital to expand her yam business. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

In this photo, Comfort is displaying a few of the yams she has cooked for the day.

loans.use: add to her capital to expand her yam business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 27 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa, junto a su querida hija Mayli de 6 años. Lo que más desea es brindar una mejor calidad de vida y para ello esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Ana sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son: el cacao, el café y la hoja de coca, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos que pueden aquejarlas. Para el futuro, planea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar sus cultivos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas de cacao y café, también comprará abono, para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her home with her beloved daughter Mayli who is 6 years old.  What she most desires is to provide her daughter with a better quality of life and she is prepared to work very hard for that.

Every day Ana leaves the house very early in the morning to work in her fields.  For her there are no rest days since she has to continually work on her farm to achieve a good production.  The main products she grows are cacao, coffee and coca leaf which she sells wholesale in the town of San Francisco.  What she most likes about her work is the freedom that she has working with her crops since she can freely enjoy her green fields.  She has been in this business for 6 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is dealing with insect infestations which can afflict her crops.

In the future, Ana plans to buy more land in order to increase her crops.  This is her third loan from MFP.  She has been very punctual in making her repayments and hopes to continue this.  She is very much liked by the other members of her community bank since she is a very happy person.  She will use the 2,000 nuevos soles she is requesting to buy cacao and coffee seeds.  She will also buy fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy coffee and cacao seeds, and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny, de 31 años, convive con Wilder, de 33 años. Ambos tiene 3 hijos: Ronald, de 13, Janeth, de 11, Jaretsy, de 9 meses de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Palca. Con la alegría que le caracteriza, Jenny, cuenta que se siente estable economicamente. En estos años su economía subió increíblemente, pues su esposo trabaja en una de las principales minas del país. Pero como mujer trabajadora, ella desea salir adelante en la actividad que más sabe, que es la agricultura. Hace 14 años que se dedica a la siembra de papa, su terreno agrícola produce 80 sacos de papa diario, los que después de cada cosecha vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Pero no solo a eso se dedica, también compra miel de Oxapampa y los vende en la ciudad de Tarma y en la capital. 

Ahora está planeando juntar más capital para poder comercializar en mayores cantidades su producción de papa y miel que compra. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y como presidenta de su banco comunal, es una mujer madura y muy hábil, que constantemente apoya a sus integrantes, ya que son mujeres luchadoras y responsables. Tiene pensado destinar el crédito solicitado, en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, por que la venta de este producto le generaría más rentabilidad, además va a necesitar contratar peones para que le ayuden en la siembra de esté producto.
texts.en:
Jenny, age 31, is living with Wilder, age 33. Together they have 3 children: Ronald, 13; Janeth, 11; and Jaretsy, 9 months old. As a family unit, they live in their own house, located in the town of Palca. With the cheerfulness that characterizes her, Jenny reports that she feels economically secure. In these years, her economic situation has risen incredibly, as her husband works in one of the country's leading mines. But as a working woman, she wants to get ahead in the activity she knows best: agriculture. For the past 14 years, she has worked growing potatoes. Her fields produce 80 sacks of potatoes each day, which she sells at the wholesale market in her city after each harvest. But this is not her only work; she also buys honey from Oxapampa and sells it in the city of Tarma and in the capital. 

She is now planning to put together some more capital so that she can sell her potato production and the honey she buys in greater quantities. This is her third loan with MFP, and as president of her communal bank, she is a highly mature and skilled woman, who is constantly supporting the other members. They are all hard-working and responsible women. She is planning to use the loan she is requesting to buy 2 bags of pea seeds and to hire field workers to help her plant peas.

loans.use: Buying 2 bags of pea seeds and hire field workers

loans.name: Yamoussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yamoussa D. est âgé de 27 ans, marié sans enfant  et résidant avec son épouse à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yamoussa D. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initié à cette activité de couture depuis l’année 2002. Son atelier de couture se trouve devant son domicile à Sanoubougou I où il dispose déjà  de 4 machines dont une machine de broderie et trois machines  de couture simples. Monsieur D. est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt., qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter une machine de broderie afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Yamoussa D. is 27 years old, married, and without any children.  He resides with his wife in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class districts in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  After having operated many businesses unsuccessfully, he got introduced to sewing as a business in 2002.  His tailoring shop is found in front of his home in Sanoubougou I, where he already has four machines, including an embroidering machine and three simple sewing machines.  

Mr. D. is in high demand by his customers for the quality of his services. Concerned about further satisfying his burgeoning customer base, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his second loan.   He plans on using this loan for buying an embroidering machine in order to respond to his customers better. 

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase his business capital, to help with family expenses, and to pay the loan interest.

loans.use: Buy a new embroidering machine

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” LOS HERALDOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Rosa María; ella tiene 45 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de compra y venta de madera al por mayor y menor a la vez la socia vende fruta y lo distribuye  a sus clientes que le solicitan, de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante.   

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como madera y frutas para sus negocios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Rosa María is a member of the 'LOS HERALDOS' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Rosa María is 45 years old, married and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying wood wholesale and selling it retail.  She also sells fruit which she delivers to her customers who request it.  In this way, she gets her family ahead in life.

Rosa María is requesting this loan to buy materials, such as wood and fruit, for her businesses.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials, such as wood and fruit, for her businesses

loans.name: Bonny Tatiana

texts.es:
Bonny Tatiana C. M., tiene 21 años, es soltera, vive con  los hijos en el  cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Bonny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es sacar a los hijos adelante.

Le gusta dormir.
texts.en:
Bonny Tatiana C. M. is 21 years old, she is single and she lives with her children and her father in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos Province. She has 2 children.

The V.R.C. Valle Alto (Valle Alto Communal Bank) is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; this group engages in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Bonny engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. She buys and sells the products in Ventanas and in the Comercial Peña, and she also sells them every day at her house or in the market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of keeping on providing for her children.

She likes sleeping.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice in bulk

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, tiene 49 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Margarita después de realizar sus actividades del hogar, ella se dedica a tender su tienda de abarrotes. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Margarita requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites y muchas cosas más.
   
Margarita pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margarita is 49 years old. She has four children and lives in the city of Cuzco, Peru. After doing her housework, Margarita works in her convenience store. She has been working in this business for a year and it is going very well for her. Margarita needs the loan to buy merchandise. For example rice, sugar, noodles, and much more.  
   
Margarita belongs to the “Yahuar Maqui” community bank, of the Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the chance offered in this way and she is also committed to making the payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: To buy merchandise. For exaple, rice, sugar, noodles, oil and much more.

loans.name: Keth

texts.es: Keth, de 41 años, es una mujer alegre y tenaz. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Amílcar de 42 años, y sus dos hijos adolescentes, por quienes se esfuerza para salir adelante. Hace más de 6 años, junto a su esposo trabajan en la reparación y mantenimiento de celulares, pero hace dos años ella es quien le dedica mayor tiempo a esta labor, ya que su esposo tiene un trabajo dependiente. Por ello, dos o tres veces por semana se provee de repuestos del emporio comercial del centro de Lima, por encargo de su  esposo, para cuando llegue a su casa; solo se dedique a reparar las imperfecciones de los celulares. En todo este tiempo de trabajo mancomunado, ella también aprendió detalles del servicio técnico  de los celulares y  le gusta lo que hace.  De esta manera Keth y su esposo se generan ganancias adicionales, con los que educan a sus hijos sin que les falte nada. Por ello, para más adelante piensa instalar un local amplio y concurrido, donde pueda trabajar formalmente. Este es su primer crédito paralelo  que tiene con MFP, donde es una asidua e incansable trabajadora, por ello dice “que con confíen en ella y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente”. De obtener el crédito que solicita,  comprará repuestos de celulares, para continuar trabajando en busca de un porvenir mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Keth, 41, is a cheerful, tenacious woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Amilcar, 42, and her two adolescent children for whom she struggles to get ahead.  For over six years together with her husband she has worked repairing and servicing cell phones.  For the last two years, however, it’s been she who has carried most of the responsibility for the work because her husband has a job elsewhere.  Because of this she stocks up on replacement parts two or three times a week at a commercial center in Lima according to her husband’s request so that when he comes home he can concentrate solely on the cell phone repairs.  During all this time of joint effort, she has learned the technical details of cell phone repair and she enjoys what she does.  In this manner, Keth and her husband generate additional profits which are what they use to educate their children not lacking anything.  Because of this, for later on she plans to set up an spacious, well-attended locale where she can work formally.

This is her first loan with MFP where she’s a regular, tireless worker.  This is why she says to have faith in her and be assured that she will pay all her installments punctually.

If she were to get the loan he’s requesting she will buy cell phone replacement parts to continue working in search of a better future for her family.

loans.use: To buy cell phone parts.

loans.name: Orsa Odalis

texts.es:
La señora Orsa, es socia del banco comunal Las Luchadoras, del Distrito de Campo Verde, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos.
Lleva 2 años trabajando con este banco comunal, se dedica a la venta de ropa, sus productos los compra en la ciudad de Lima.  Su esposo también es comerciante.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará; 1 doc. de pantalones, para caballero, 1 doc. de polos para caballero, 1 doc. de pantalones, 1 doc. de polos, ½ doc. de camisas, 1/2 doc. de pantalones de niños, ½ doc. de polos para niñas, ½ doc. de vestidos para niña.
Su mercadería lo vende en su casa, que está a 15 kilómetros del distrito de Campo Verde, por eso que trae mercadería una vez por mes, ya se hizo de una clientela fija que cuando tiene novedades ellos vienen a su casa. La señora Orsa nos cuenta que el negocio está creciendo cada vez más.
texts.en:
Orsa, 41, is a member of the Las Luchadoras community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ucayali.  She is married and has 5 children.
Orsa has been a member of the community bank for 5 years.  She operates a business buying and selling clothing.  She buys her merchandise in Lima and brings it to Ucayali for sale.  Her husband is a merchant, as well.  
Orsa will use this loan, for S/.3,000 new soles, to buy a dozen pairs of men's trousers, a dozen sport shirts for men and other clothing for adults and children that she will resell.  
She operates the business from her house, some 15 kilometers from Campo Verde (where the community bank is based).  She brings her merchandise from there once a month.  Orsa has a loyal customer base who come to see her whenever she has anything new in stock and she tells us that the business is growing by the month.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for clothing sales business

loans.name: Aun

texts.en: Aun, who was born in 1980, is married to Hun. They have two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the youngest is three years old. Aun is a farmer and owns a one-hectare plot of land, where she can grow rice to sell some of rice yield and use the rest of the rice to support her family. Besides farming, she has a lot of free time. So, to improve this condition, Aun is seeking a loan to buy two piglets and a cow for breeding to start a new business. Her husband is a construction worker and he cuts fire wood for selling, too.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and a cow

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pottery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for pottery and for renovation of her pottery business.  Amy has been in this business for 8 years. She earns other income from fishing.

Amy is sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.   She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for pottery business

loans.name: Nury Del Socorro

texts.es:
Debido a su separación a sus 49 años de edad, Nury del Socorro M. G., se vio obligada a emprender su propio negocio, producción y venta de arepas, el cual se ha convertido en la fuente de sustento para ella y sus dos hijos. 

Desde las 3:00 de la mañana esta emprendedora está en pie realizando las labores propias de su negocio y aunque su larga jornada va hasta después del medio día, Nury está convencida de que sólo así podrá salir adelante y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos quienes son el motor que la impulsa a trabajar día a día. 

Nury trabaja con el sueño de mejorar su negocio hasta convertirse en una empresa reconocida que genere mayores ingresos. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar un horno a gas lo que le mejorará el proceso puesto que es más rápido y le reducirá los costos que actualmente debe pagar por el servicio de energía.
texts.en:
Due to her separation at 49 years old, Nury del Socorro M. G. had to start her own business making and selling arepas, which supports her and her two children.

At 3:00am, this entrepreneur is on her feet doing work for her business, and her long day goes until after noon.  Nury is convinced that this is the way she can succeed and offer her children a better quality of life.  This is what drives her to work every day.  

Nury works with the dream of improving her business and having it become a recognized store that generates a larger income.  She currently is asking for a loan to purchase a gas stove, which will improve the process because it is faster and will reduce the costs she pays for energy.

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove.

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
En el municipio El Sauce en León, la señora Aura es una persona muy alegre y con muy buenos valores morales que ha cultivado desde muy pequeña. Es casada y con la responsabilidad de cuidar de sus hijos en conjunto con su cónyuge. Una de las características que ella tiene es que ha sabido brindar a sus pequeños la educación por lo que tiene el sueño que estos se desarrollen y lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.

Hoy en día ella está atravesando una necesidad y es que debe fortalecer las paredes de su casa y darle una mejora. Para esto ella ha solicitado un crédito para darle lugar a la compra de cemento y arena y así llevar a cabo su obra de construcción que tanto requiere en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Aura lives El Sauce in the department of Leon. She is a very happy person with good moral values that she has been developing since she was a child. She is married and is responsible for taking care of her children, along with her spouse. One of her characteristics is that she knows how to educate her children, since she dreams that they develop as people and grow to be grand professionals.

Today she realizing the need to strengthen the walls of her home. For this reason she has asked for a loan to purchase cement and sand to begin the construction that her home so requires.

loans.use: to purchase bricks and cement to renovate her home.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane was born in 1977. She lives in Kapan with her retired parents. Since 2004, Gayane has been running her own business: a small hairdressing and beauty salon. Her salon stays open until late in the evening and is open every day of the week. Gayane has a lot of regular customers, who are content with the salon’s services. She buys hair dyes, hairsprays, cosmetic remedies and necessary accessories from Yerevan.
Gayane is asking for a 900,000 AMD loan to buy a chair for hairwashing and some cosmetic remedies for her salon. This is Gayane’s seventh loan from Kiva partner, Nor Horizon, and she has never made a late repayment.

loans.use: to buy a chair for hairwashing and some cosmetic remedies for her salon.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with eight children; three attend school while five have already graduated from school. Mwanakombo owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 2 years, Mwanakombo has operated a business making mats, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanakombo faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, the availability of materials for her weaving business is minimal. Mwanakombo wants to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase weaving materials for her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her business.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

For the past three years, Purity has operated a clothing sales business, selling at wholesale to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenges are seasonality and the high cost of transportation. Purity dreams of owning a boutique business in the future. She plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase three bales of secondhand clothes for sale. Purity decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase three bales of secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.es: La señora Rose Marie trabaja realizando tramites y ayuda social que realiza en una oficina la misma queda ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora portátil, para ofrecer una atención mejor y más rápida a sus clientes. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que su solicitud de crédito es canalizada a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Rose Marie prepares legal paperwork and carries out social assistance work in an office which is located in the city of El Alto.  She needs a loan to buy a laptop so that she can provide her customers with a better and quicker service.  She lives in her parents' home which is in San Pedro district, in the city of La Paz.  Rose Marie is divorced and has three children.  This is the second time that one of her loan requests has been channelled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to use in her work

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Como madre cabeza de hogar de tres hijos, Judith ha sido una luchadora incansable que se ha rebuscado la manera de salir adelante y generar sus propios ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

A sus 41 años de edad, Judith vende café, dulces y snaks en el tradicional Parque Bolívar de la ciudad de Medellín y aunque se ve enfrentada a algunas dificultades como el clima, esta emprendedora es dedicada y perseverante. 

Judith necesita de un préstamo para comprar más termos y comprar mayor variedad de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes y así incrementar sus ventas y por lo tanto sus ingresos.
texts.en:
As a mother and the head of a household with three children, Judith has been a tireless fighter who has searched for a way to get ahead and generate her own income to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

At the age of 41, Judith sells coffee, sweets and snacks in the traditional Bolivar Park, in the city of Medellin. Even though she faces some difficulties, such as the climate, this entrepreneur is dedicated and persevering.

Judith needs a loan to purchase more thermoses and a greater variety of products to offer to her customers. This will increase her sales and thus her income.

loans.use: to purchase thermoses and a variety of products.

loans.name: Mariela Mercedes

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de la comarca san jose de apante, se desempeña como maestra de primaria, tiene 8 años de impartir clases, su núcleo familiar consta con 3 personas su esposo y su hija, está solicitando financiamiento para compra de cemento, zinc, bloque, arena, tornillos y mano de obra, para construcción de cocina, esta señora está siendo beneficiada con  la firma del convenio del mismo colegio, ya que de esa manera mejorara sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This woman is originally from the region of San Jose de Apante.  She works as an elementary school teacher and has been teaching for eight years.  Her family consists of three people: herself, her husband and her daughter.  

She is requesting a loan to buy cement, zinc, blocks, sand, screws, as well as pay for labor to build a kitchen.  This woman is the beneficiary of an agreement between her school and CEPRODEL so that she can improve her conditions and her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor for building a kitchen.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a twenty-six-year-old married man with one child and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests on him and his dream is to build a permanent house for residence. He has been in a boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) business for four years. He was previously employed by someone else and now he owns two motorcycles. His hardships are accidents and mechanical breakdown of motorcycles.

His vision is to buy two more motorcycles plus starting a business for his wife.  John needs the loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 40 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling onions and cooking oil in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Christine requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil, and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 48 years old, married, and she and her husband have  five children. She is a fruit seller  which she has been doing for the last five  years. 


She learned about KADET LTD through marketing done by the KADET staff. She is a good client and this is her 1st loan which she is planning to use to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest back into her business.

Her hope and dream is to become a great business lady. She is a vigorous woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 36-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. He has owned a car wash in his village since 2006. In addition, he works as a mechanic specialized in changing cars' oil. He works hard and helps his father, who works as a farmer, with the household expenses. Today, he is applying for a loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his work by purchasing additional car oil. He hopes that the loan will help him increase his business productivity and therefore his income.

loans.use: to improve his work by purchasing additional car oils

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 58 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Letecia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. She has borrowed and paid back 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.
Letecia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 44 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City with her husband and three children. 

Julieta has a clothing business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month.  

She requests a loan of 10,000 to purchase more clothes to sell.  Julieta has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Subira B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Subira B Group in Western Kenya! Wyclife is the facilitator of the Subira B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Wyclife takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Wyclife had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Wyclife was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Wyclife and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from the maize sales, Wyclife will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Subira B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. In 2004, he was able to start his own business working as a construction laborer. He has been involved in this occupation for more than 10 years. Ali works really hard and has two part-time employees assisting him. Today, he’s looking to borrow $1,000 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional construction equipment to continue his work appropriately. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction equipment

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her embroidery business. She is an expert in decorative embroidery and makes beautiful clothes for her clients. Razia is motivated to create interesting and beautiful designs on clothes to attract more clients to her business. 

Razia is the mother of two sons and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She is very experienced in her work and has been operating her business successfully for many years. The income from her business has proven very beneficial in improving her family's life. She can now can support her husband financially.

With the loan, Razia will buy beads, colored thread, and other materials in larger quantities for making even better-looking embroidered clothes. She is confident that a loan will help her to generate more profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy beads and thread for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Sinoko Shg Group

texts.en:
Abraham is the facilitator of the Sinoko SHG group. Abraham and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Abraham takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Abraham had an excellent maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Abraham was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Abraham and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Abraham will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sinoko SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Abraham is pictured with his group members and standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jenny Dolores

texts.es:
Jenny Dolores tiene 23 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene dos hijas, vive con el esposo y con las hijas de 5 años y 9 meses de edad en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.
Es integrante de la VRC LAS BRISAS, se encuentra ubicada en las calles 6 de Octubre y Asad Bucaran Sector el hospital, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Se dedican a labores comerciales en general.
Jenny tiene una mini tienda donde vende víveres. Las compras lo hace en Ventanas y las ventas lo hace en la casa ahí tiene la mini tienda.
Solicita el crédito para equipar la mini tienda de más productos y mercadería y ponerlo en inventario.
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá aumentar y agrandar un poco de lo que ya está.
El sueño es seguir estudiando para ser una profesional. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con las niñas.
texts.en:
Jenny Dolores is 23 years old, and is in a common-law marriage with two daughters.  She lives with her husband and her daughters, who are aged 5 years and 9 months, in Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

She is a member of the Las Brisas [The Breezes] communal bank, which is located on 6th October street and Asad Bucaran street, in the Hospital part of town, in the Ventanas canton.  The members work in general retail work.

Jenny has a mini-store where she sells food.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas, and makes her sales out of her home, which is where she has her mini-store.

She is requesting the loan to stock up her mini-store with more products and merchandise, to build up her inventory.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to expand and grow little by little from where things currently stand.

Her dream is to continue studying to become a professional.  She hasn't experienced any kinds of problems with her work.  

She likes to spend her free time with her children.

loans.use: to stock up her mini-store with more products and merchandise, to build her inventory.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 51 years old.  She is a single mother of two children aged 29 and 30 years. She operates a computer services business and has been in business for four years. She earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES running this business.

This is Milka’s fourth loan with KADET ltd. and she has a good credit history.  She will use this loan to buy a printer and a computer.  In the future, Milka hopes to start a printing business.

loans.use: to buy a printer and a computer.

loans.name: July

texts.es:
July, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación, además  de ser alegre y amable, es conviviente con Julio quien se dedica a la construcción civil, vive en compañía de su pareja y sus dos hijos de 16 y 6 años de edad  a los que quiere mucho, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realiza July, es la venta de bebidas heladas como gaseosas, y helados de marcas reconocidas y de sabores tropicales. Para eso cuenta con una congeladora para las bebidas y una exhibidora prestada por la empresa de helados para la exhibición de los helados. Lleva dedicándose a estas actividades desde hace 3 años de manera permanente y atendiendo ella sola muy amablemente a todos sus clientes, sin tener problemas con los créditos otorgados hasta la fecha. Le gusta sus actividades pues le permiten estar en casa para cuidar de sus hijos menores de edad, así como apoyar con la economía de su hogar y colaborará con su pareja, ya que viendo los buenos resultados que tiene y las ganancias que le genera decidió continuar con sus negocio, teniendo planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir un bodega de ventas de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 15 con institución MFP. Está agradecida por el apoyo que viene recibiendo durante este largo tiempo que lleva con su banco comunal, deseando seguir cotando con éste apoyo se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores, además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus miembros.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles tiene planes de invertir en la compra de mercaderías, como juguetes y ropa para niños, y ponerlos a la venta en su casa.
texts.en:
July, age 40, is a happy, kind woman who has a great desire to succeed. She lives with Julio, who works in civil construction, and their two beloved children ages 6 and 16. They live in their own home. July sells frozen drinks such as pop, as well as ice cream from known brand names in tropical flavours. She has a freezer for the drinks and a display case borrowed from the ice cream company to display the ice cream. She has had this business for three years. She is the only one who works in this business, and tends to her customers on her own with very kind service. She has had no problems with her loans thus far. She enjoys her job because it allows her to be at home to take care of her young children, as well as helping out with the household income. Her profits are good, and she will use them to continue with her business. She has plans to expand her business and open a grocery store in her home. This will be her fifteenth loan with MFP. She is grateful for this support over such a long period of time in her communal bank. She hopes to continue counting on this support and promises to continue paying off her loans as she has before. She is comfortable with her communal bank because she knows the majority of the members.
With the requested 1500 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise such as toys and clothing for children, and sell them out of her home.

loans.use: to buy toys and children's clothing.

loans.name: Leyerlita

texts.en:
This is Leyerlita, 39, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Pedrito, a construction worker. She is also mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Leyerlita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Leyerlita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jibril Ahmed

texts.en: Jibril Ahmed is 27 years old. He finished Nairobi University. Jibril is a teacher of young Muslim academics in Hargeisa town. His main challenge is that he has no laptop. He needs the laptop to prepare school lessons, exams, exercises, and to store student grades. Kaaba provided him with a laptop that he can pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en:
Marie Gorette aged 41 years. She is married with 5 children aged between 7 and 16 years. They all of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to pay school fees of her children to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Lispar

texts.en:
Lispar is a lively and resilient woman. She is from the Chuka area, an area that is very affected by poverty, inequality and social conflict. She intends for her family to get ahead through her hard work and effort without complaint. Lispar has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells milk, poultry and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Lispar is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life.

Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutritional value. She is so keen and close with her cows, she has named them, which makes Lispar very proud, and she feels fulfilled. Dairy farming being a very profitable business venture, Lispar wants to take full advantage. She would like to expand her dairy business, but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows.

She is respectfully asking for a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used for cutting hay into smaller pieces before being mixed with other forages for easy digestion by the cow. The loan will assist the cow in producing more milk because they will have plenty of food to feed on. The profits from milk sales will allow Lispar to grow her business further, by starting to package milk and by processing it into other dairy products. In addition, she will benefit from the organic manure from the cow. She projects that she will be able to start a bio-gas plant at her farm, which will save her money in fuel costs. With your loan, all that Lispar dreams of is a secure future for her family. Lispar awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter.

loans.name: Christella

texts.en:
Christella is working as telemarketer. She has her own business, too. She runs a small enterprise in which her team manufactures detergents and liquid soaps for consumers. The business idea came to her during a visit in DR.

Christella has four main markets: hotels, schools, restaurants and households. Christella has created part-time jobs for six people. She would like to create more, as well as making more profits.

Her obstacle for now is the lack of raw materials to produce in volume and to make scalable economy on costs. That's why she turns to Zafen to achieve that commercial objective.

From left to right, Christella (left) is pictured with Lory (her co-manager) and Emaneste (sales manager).

With this loan, she will also create three more jobs and buy aprons and bonnets for her employees.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials to manufacture detergents for homes.

loans.name: Lubomir

texts.en: Lubomir D. is 52 years old. He is married and has an elder boy and a girl. Lubomir is in entertaining business for more than twenty years. Previously he has been a barman and manager in many restaurants on the east sea coast and later he had a fruit and vegetable trade business. A serious disease made him stop for a while and when he recovered he had lost his business contacts. Then Lubomir decided to do the business he knew best. Two years ago he rented the coffee bar in the Bourgas Theatre House. The coffee bar is small but cosy and its regular customers are people of artistic sphere. It is a family business and Lubomir’s wife and two kids also work in it. Now Lubomir wants to make repairs in the coffee bar and needs a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: To make repairs in the coffee bar

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa has been selling pharmaceuticals for about 13 years. She decided to set up a pharmacy because there were none near her sector. Her business has done well due to the lack of competition, but she has not been able to meet the demand of the local area. Her lack of capital has not allowed her to sell a large variety of products or offer lower prices. She is seeking the Kiva loan in order to purchase a variety of goods at larger wholesale quantities. Rosa is 38 years old, she is married and has two children. The youngest of her children will be starting school this year. Her priority is to provide them both with an education.

loans.use: Invest in new medicines and other health products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase and selling cereals

loans.name: Fiaola

texts.en:
Fiaola is a 36 year-old mother of two from Seesee. She is a hard working mother who is willing to earn money to fund her childrens' school and also for the betterment of her family. She is married and she joined SPBD this year 2007 with a loan of $750 in order to start up a fast-food store. She sells taro, banana, yam and luau to the public in front of one of the shops near her home. She does business three days a week and that is on Tuesday, Thursday and Friday, and she earns $260 per day. After all the deductions is being made, her leftover profit is $160.

With this new loan, Fiaola would like to buy cement, iron roof, timber, a sack of taro and bunches of bananas for her fast-food store.

loans.use: Fiaola would like to buy cement, iron roof, timber, a sack of taro and bunches of bananas for her fast-food store.

loans.name: Nahid

texts.en:
Mr. K. is a local inhabitant of Beylagan. He is married and is 31 years old.
He has been in this business for several years. He does furniture repair and manufactures furniture for clients. He has borrowed 4 loans from Normicro and now applies for $800 now to buy materials for repair.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to do furniture

loans.name: Ramal

texts.en: Ramal lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Ramal is 26 years old and single. He has raised cattle for 4 years. He would like a loan of $950 to buy fodder and baling presses, and keep his cattle well fed. Ramal hopes to increase the number of his cattle to improve his business and to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy feed and baling presses for his cattle

loans.name: Nelea

texts.en:
Lotions, potions and pills are Mama M.’s speciality. She established the ‘Nekana Medical Store’ in 2004 and now requires a loan of $875 to expand the business by purchasing a larger quantity and range of stock. Nelea is a single mother and the business enables her to support her three children, Natojua, 16, Joseba, 14, and Eliza, 12.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional drugs for her medical store

loans.name: Agustini

texts.en: Agustini, 42, is the mother of 2 children. She sells cosmetics on credit ,door-to-door, such as perfume, powder, etc., earning about US$ 26 a month. Her husband, Agus Salim, sells frames, earning US$ 20 a week. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$ 75 to add to her business capital. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Adding to her business capital

loans.name: Maiden

texts.en: Maiden E. is 52 years old, and is married with 6 children. She has a catering business, and has been in business since 2002. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She needs a loan of $300 to buy a mixing and cutting machine for her business.

loans.use: To buy a mixing machine and a cutting machine for my catering business

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Mrs Seynabou F. was born in 1960, is married and has been a member of the Ngollar Village Bank for five and a half years. She has received 11 loans which have always been repaid without problem. Her business activity enables her to take care of the schooling of her children and day-to-day expenses. Seynabou is requesting this loan to strengthen her sheep business and plans to repay it after six months in one installement.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Seynabou F., née en 1960 , mariée est membre du Banc villageois de Ngollard depuis 5 ans et demi, Elle a bénéficié de 11 prêts qui ont toujours été remboursés sans difficultés. Avec son activité elle arrive à prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et la dépense quotidienne. Pour renforcer son activité d' embauche ovine ,Seynabou sollicite ce prêt et propose de rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy rams and animal feed

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
I am Naseem F., a mother of seven girls and one boy, and I reside with my family in the small town of Borewala, Pakistan. My elder girls dropped school due to some family problems, but the younger girls still attend, while my son runs a salon, a business he has operated for the last four years. The only income earner of the family, he works very hard to improve our financial situation, and he currently needs to renovate his salon and buy chairs and tables for it.

I have been joined by two other women in my loan group: Razia B., who will buy wood, and Khursheed B., a widow who is borrowing for her daughter’s embroidery business.

loans.use: To renovate the existing salon

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia M. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is married with 6 children. She is 40 years old. Patricia has been in business for 4 years. She owns a small store. This was a business she started in the year 2004. She needs a loan of $300 to buy more drinks for sales. She expresses her thanks to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sales

loans.name: Sootino

texts.en: Sootino F., 33, is single with no children.  She has many years of experience in the grocery business. She sells to the village community district 6 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $187 USD.  SPBD loans are Sootino’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of the profits will be used to pay children's education fees. Sootino is a single woman but she contributes to the needs of all the children in her extended family .

loans.use: The loan will be used for purchasing sack s of flour, boxes  of cooking oil,sacks of rice,sacks of baking powder,boxes  of deodorant and canned fish.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nguyen, 54 years old, joined the Fund in 2001. In the past 7 years of participation in the Fund, her family has experience much improvement in their finances and afford more conveniences. She was able to build houses for 3 of her children so each can live on their own. Two children still live at home with her and are attending school. In each round of funding, the family invested in farming fish. With the money invested they were able to have the fish pond right near their house so the business of tending to the fish was very favorable. Her husband is a hardworking person with an inquisitive mindset in the profession of raising seafood, so the family’s investment in raising fish always brings in a high income. In this round of funding the family is requesting 11,000,000 VND to continue investing in raising the fish. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month on average.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia Quỹ năm 2001, chị Nguyễn Thị L. năm nay 54 tuổi qua 7 năm tham gia vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình chị đã có nhiều thay đổi, mua sắm tiện nghi trong gia đình, xây dựng gia đình cho 3 con và đều làm cho mỗi con một dinh cơ ra ở riêng, 2 con đang sống cùng chị đều đi học, các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi cá, với lợi thế gia đình chị có ao ngay tại nhà nên viêc chăn nuôi, chăm sóc rất thuận lợi, chồng chị là người chịu khó luôn học hỏi kinh nghiệm trong việc nuôi trồng thủy sản, vì vậy nên gia đình anh chị đầu tư vào ao cá luôn có thu nhập cao cho gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 11.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào nuôi cá. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising Fish

loans.name: Kantutitas Group

texts.es:
The group, consisting of both old members and one new, is in its third cycle. All partners have been good participants in the past, and are therefore expected to demonstrate the same behavior in this cycle. 13 female members and 1 male member comprise the Kantutitas communal bank.

Patricia is the president and has sold vegetables for a year. Ana knits blankets, Elena has prepared chicken for 9 years, Carmen is a seamstress, Francisca sews jackets, Edith makes cakes, Miriam sells ironworks materials, Gladis and Eulalia weave blankets and Lydia sells them, Jhoana takes care of a neighborhood store, Maria sells clothes and Hieronymite is a chauffeur.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo está en tercer ciclo, el mismo está conformado por socias antiguas y una nueva, todas demostraron un buen comportamiento en el anterior ciclo, por lo que se espera un comportamiento igual en el presente ciclo. Son 13 las socias y un socio que conforman este banco de las cuales Patricia que es la presidenta se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace un año atrás, Ana teje mantas, Elena confecciona polleras desde hace 9 años, Carmen costura prendas, Francisca costura chamarras, Edith elabora tortas, Miriam se dedica a la venta de material de ferretería, Gladis y Eulalia tejen mantas y Lidia las vende, Jhoana atiende una tienda de barrio, Maria vende ropa y Jeronimo es chofer propietario.

loans.use:
Operating Capital
Capital de operaciones

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María, socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín,  Distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de Mantequilla de maní, mermelada de frutas, chupetes, hielos y productos de belleza. El negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 1325. Sus clientes son vecinos de su barrio y familiares. Trabaja con pedidos.
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual se pagará en 6 meses, comprará maní en saco, sal, frutas naturales de la estación, azúcar en saco, bolsas de chupetes entre otros. También comprará productos de belleza en oferta de la marca Esika, Unique, Avon, para surtir el negocio y de esa manera pueda tener mayor ganancia y volver a invertir nuevamente.

Ana María tiene 43 años, 03 hijos, quienes todavía dependen de ella. Siempre se ha destacado por ser una mujer decidida, trabajadora y buena administradora. Su meta es ampliar el negocio, poner una vitrina para mostrar sus productos de belleza y tener una empresa agroindustrial.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana María is a member of the communal bank “Our Lady of Peace,” and lives in the Department and Province of San Martín, district of Tarapoto. She sells peanut butter, fruit jam, lollipops, ices and beauty products. The business is located in her home, Jr. Leonicio Prado No 1325. Her customers are neighbors and relatives. She works on a per-order basis. With a loan of 800 soles (US $275), which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy a sack of peanuts, salt, seasonal fruits, a sack of sugar, and bags of lollipops, among other things. She will also buy beauty products by the brands Esika, Unique and Avon to take to her business and she will be able to have higher profit and to re-invest again. Ana María is 43 years old and has three children who still depend on her. She has always stood out as a woman who is determined, hardworking and a good manager. Her goal is to expand her business, to install a showcase to display her beauty products and have an agribusiness company.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sack of peanuts, salt, seasonal fruits, sugar, bags of lollipops, etc.

loans.name: Aia

texts.en:
Aia T., 39, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in the canteen business. She sells to the village people and the public 5 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~83 USD).

Aia has one previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Aia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of the loan will be used to fund her business. Aia is a young mother aiming to be successful in the future.

loans.use: Purchase chips, popcorn, twisties, and drinks

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat Z. is 54 years old. Together with her husband, who is the entrepreneur, Muhabbat raised three children, all of whom are already married and independent of the parents. She has been running a drug store for 1 year, selling only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the city which allows her to have many clients and customers. With the help of a loan she wants to expand her business

loans.use: Muhabbat would like to expand her business and purchasing equipment for her drugstore.

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Paraíso”, ubicado en el Jr. José Olaya Mz O Lt. 29, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años de edad y es madre soltera con 3 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos lácteos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de zapatos, el cual le brinda ganancias para pagar su préstamo puntualmente.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1.000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 10 docenas de zapatos para vender a sus clientes.

Rosa es una mujer luchadora. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to the El Paraiso Community Bank, located at Jr. José Olaya Mz O Lt. 29, in the district of Yarinacocha, province of Coronel Portillo, in the department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and a single mother with three children dependent on her. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of S/. 300 she decided to invest in the sale of dairy products. Currently she works selling shoes, which offer earnings allowing her to pay back her loan on time. With this loan of S/. 1,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 10 dozen pairs of shoes to sell to her customers. Rosa is a fighting woman. She is grateful for the help offered by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 10 dozen pairs of shoes

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: T. Pierrette s’est marié avec EGBENOU Cosme. Elle est née à 1961. Elle a quatre enfants, 26, 23, 18, et 11. Dame T. n’a pas eu l’opportunité d’une éducation, mais tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Elle cuisine la nourriture comme l’igname frites, les haricots, les ananas, et les bananes frites les soirs pour le diner. Elle achète sa nourriture a Tokpa, et elle vend également le charbon de bois.  A cause de l’économie, elle a vu une diminution dans sa vente, mais elle se débrouille et elle veut aggrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Pierrette T. is married to Cosme Egbenou. She was born in 1961. She has 4 children, aged 26, 23, 18, and 11. Mrs. T. was not able to get an education, but all her children are enrolled in school. She cooks food such as fried yams, beans, pineapple, and fried bananas to sell evenings at dinnertime. She buys her provisions in Tokpa and she also sells charcoal. Because of the economy, she has noticed that she is making fewer sales, but she is managing to get by and she wants to expand her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of food ingredients: coco yams, beans, etc.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama K. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three children. All her kids are in school. She lives in a community called Abirem a suburb of Nkawkaw in the eastern region of Ghana. Ama has sold frozen foods in the local market to support her family for four years now. Through this business she has managed to acquire two plots of land for pigs. Through good human relations and customer care, she has maintained quite a number of customers.

She says demand for frozen fish is high but she does not meet the capital requirement to meet such demands. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her to raise enough income to support her children's education. Ama belongs to a village bank called ‘Asetenapa’ which means 'good living'. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Chheang Chhem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people living in Phum Saeprambei village in Kampong Cham province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chheang C., the 38- year-old village bank president, is a laborer who has a little salary. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are attending the local school. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Chheang C. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase a breeding cow

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es: Ofelia del Carmen C. vive en Santa Tecla, departamento La Libertad. Ofelia es madre soltera, vive con su hijo y su madre que es un apoyo para esta mujer que se encuentra sola en las responsabilidades económicas. Ofelia y su madre son un gran equipo,  que a pesar de de las adversidades y la competencia en  la zona han logrado sostener su tiene por muchos años pero con la necesidad de superación y salir a adelante ahora no solo se dedican a la tienda, ha Ofelia le surgió la idea de poner un comedor a unas cuadras de la casa donde viven;  ya que es una zona muy transitada. Así es como ahora este equipo de madre e hija han logrado sostener su tienda y ahora tener un comedor con mucha afluencia de clientes. Ahora Ofelia solicita un crédito para compra de mercadería para su tienda y  comedor ya que su cantidad de clientes va a aumentando y necesita abastecerse de productos para su cocina.
texts.en:
Ofelia del Carmen C. lives in Santa Tecla, department of La Libertad. Ofelia is a single mother, lives with her son and her mother who provides some support to this woman who finds herself bearing the financial responsibilities alone. Ofelia and her mother are a great team, in spite of the adversities and the competition in the area, they have been able to maintain their store for many years. With the desire to excel and get ahead they are now not only taking care of the store, but Ofelia had an idea of also opening a diner several blocks from where they live, since it is a high traffic area. This mother/daughter team has maintained their store and now have a diner with a large client base. Ofelia is now requesting a loan to purchase merchandise for her store and diner since the number of customers is increasing and she needs to increase the supply of products for her kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.ru: Клиентка Бободжонова Зебунисо в возросте 51 год, замужем имеет одного сына, высшего образования не имеет. Проживает в городе Вахдат, клиентка занимается торговлей более 15 лет у неё имееется собственнуая торговая точка, которая находится, на центральном  рынке. Муж клиентки работает на томже рынке, охраником.На полученные деньги клиентка хочет увеличить свой товар, в виде закупа материала.
texts.en:
Client Zebuniso B. is a 51 year old resident of the city of Vahdat, and is married and has one son. She did not complete higher education. She has worked in sales for over 15 years, and now sells goods from her own trading stall at the central market. Her husband works as a security guard at the same market. She wants to use the funds received to expand her selection of goods by buying fabric.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory expansion

loans.name: Rosemond

texts.en:
Rosemond A. is 51 years old. She is married with five children who are currently in school due to the help of government free compulsory education for every child. However, she is still constrained with inadequate funds to make business progress.

She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, tinned tomatoes, spices, eggs, toothpaste, canned foods, toilet soap, etc. She has run this business for 22 years. Through this, she used the proceeds to cater for her household needs. She travels to Accra, which is one of the busiest markets, where she buys her stock of goods.

She deems it an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, canned foods, toothpaste, etc., to increase her stock of goods available for sale. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Ebenezer’.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her grocery shop

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is married to Edgar M.. She is 55 years old and manages a general store in their village. She sells different types of merchandise at retail. She also wants to expand her business by selling other commodities and cooked food. She loves her business thus wants to further develop it. She hopes to borrow 12,000 Philippine Pesos to pursue her plans and gain more income for her family.

They have five children: Legarda - 36 years old; Maria Victorina - 34 years old; Dulce - 31 years old; Lisette - 28 years old and Joanne - 25 years old. Her husband accompanies her in the business. The couple loves to cook different dishes so they are planning to put up a small eatery when they have enough capital. They are looking forward to the progress of their business through the financial support from the lenders accompanied by patience and hard work.

loans.use: To expand the variety of goods sold

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund Q. is single and is taking care of one of his brother’s children. He has received an education through senior high school.

Since 2003, Edmund has sold lining, thread and other sewing materials in Cape Coast. He also works as a tailor, specializing in sewing men’s clothing. Edmund uses his income to take care of his brother’s child.

Edmund will use the loan to purchase more sewing materials for resale and to also buy equipment to improve his services. With the new profits from his expanded business, Edmund plans to reinvest back into his enterprise in order to increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials and to buy equipment to improve his services

loans.name: Taibatu

texts.en: Taibatu is 40 years old and married with three children. She sells medicines, jewelry and drinks.  She is requesting the loan of N80,000 to purchase more medicines and jewelry to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Mary Serungoji Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 31 years old and married with one child aged 12 years. Her child goes to school. She resides and owns a three-roomed house where she is living with six people. She takes care of four additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets two meals a day.

Mary resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a shop selling clothing materials in Kiyembe, one of the Kampala suburbs. She sells to an average of five people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week and uses public transport to work. Her major monthly expenses include medication, school fees, feeding the family and rent for the business premises.

Mary has been in this business for the last fifteen years. Her main challenge is license fees.
